name: Wisconsin State Capitol
address: 2 E Main St, Madison, WI 53703, USA
reviews: What a unique place! I discovered quite a bit of United States history here. And the paintings are beautifully painted. Lots of architecture to take a look at. And plenty of bathrooms on every floor. If you're looking for a place to sit down, there are leather chairs outside the supreme court courtroom on the second floor, in addition to benches outside the Capitol itself

The Capitol’s Art and Architecture Gives Great Aesthetic Pleasure -  The capitol building is a marvel - built with over 40 different types of marble, great art throughout, and interiors lit by natural light.  Definitely take the free tour.  Afterward enjoy the downtown area.  There are great nearby restaurants, small cafes, and a modern art museum.  On Wednesday enjoy the Concert in Capitol Square and on Saturday morning enjoy the farmers market surrounding the capitol.

Beautiful building - the tallest in Madison and without a doubt it's most iconic structure. The daily tours are informative and the history of the capitol building itself and the city are fascinating. It's beautiful when lit at night.

If you have never visited Madison before this should be your first sight seeing stop. You can tour it on your own but I would recommend taking one of the guided tours as it will definitely enhance your visit. This beautiful building is a great repository of Wisconsin history. The panoramic view from the top also is not to be missed.

As I imagine is tradition visiting a town for the first time, I took a stroll down town around the capital building. It was absolutely gorgeous! The entire town of Madison impressed the hell out of me, and I'll definitely be going back. The capital building is stunning, with great architecture and lots of small details to discover. Exploring inside was well worth it, and it was nice and air conditioned on the 85+ degree weather day. Will most definitely be going again to explore down town and the surrounding areas!

name: University of Wisconsin-Madison Arboretum
address: 1207 Seminole Hwy, Madison, WI 53711, USA
reviews: The arboretum is close by to my home. Over the years, I found great comfort escaping the city noise by walking through a woodland, a prairie, a pond. All still natural state. Delightful!
Among the nicest gardens in Midwest.
This place is beautiful year round. Parking can get difficult to find when it gets real busy, but always worth the trip.

What an awesome treat. I'm not sure if this is a popular destination but it sure should be. Especially considering it's free and open to public.  A colorful escape in the middle of Madison. You could spend several hours just taking pictures and admiring of all the vibrant plants you see here. The gardens were fantastic. The trails were okay and well I'm not sure about the pond thou lol
I now live next door so am excited to have such a great opportunity to enjoy year round. We attended the meteor shower event here by the UW Space Place on Park St. It was amazing.

name: Madison Children's Museum
address: 100 N Hamilton St, Madison, WI 53703, USA
reviews: Our company hosted our annual winter party at the Madison Children’s Museum earlier in January. It was an absolute blast! We were so impressed by the planning process we went through with the staff at the museum. They had such great suggestions and have really nailed down the coordination of large events at their venue. They worked seamlessly with our caterer, DJ, and many other vendors, which made the planning of our event both pleasant and effortless. Our guests had so much fun playing in all of the exhibits, especially the giant hamster wheel! We highly recommend the Madison Children’s Museum for any event (even when there aren’t any children attending)!

Ben P., the animal education specialist in the Clubhouse on the rooftop was the absolute highlight for my kids & I!!!!  He is full of energy, friendly, knowledgeable and entertaining!  He made learning about the animals interactive & fun!  He asked my kids thought provoking questions, taught them how to be calm around the animals, how to hold them and had them engaged the entire time!  He had them really thinking about the animals and got them excited about it all! He was our ultimate absolute # 1 FAVORITE part of the entire museum! If it wasn’t for him, our experience would have been ... meh (only because the museum is geared more towards littler kids).  But because he gave us the experience of a lifetime, we highly recommend this Children’s museum!  My kids got to touch and hold; 2 snakes, bearded dragon, gecko, tortoise & a huge chicken!  Most importantly, they were excited about learning more about our native Wisconsin snakes and more!  Ben, you lit up our day and made our trip extremely memorable!  Thank you!  Please gives this hardworking guy a raise!

I think this will be more fun once my son is a couple years older but for now it's really only entertaining for maybe 30 minutes as he crawls around the under 5 area. In the summer the rooftop is beautiful and he enjoyed looking at the plants and animals up there. It's still a beautiful museum, I just wish there were more for the barely mobile kids.

The children’s museum is A really fun and educational place to take your children. I have been taking my children to this museum since they were very young, they always seem to enjoy it every time especially when I treat them to ice cream in the lobby. There’s always something to do for them to learn and have a good time while interacting with other children. With affordable rates for families of all incomes this is definitely a place children from all backgrounds in ages can enjoy.

They finally changed it up some and kids had a blast. One of the only things to do on a Sunday for kids/toddlers. Plus entire staff was great but one of the workers Destany was so awesome! She made sure we were having fun and was very helpful when asked her questions.

name: Chazen Museum of Art
address: 800 University Ave, Madison, WI 53706, USA
reviews:
One of my favorite art museums. An eclectic collection that has something for everyone.

And it's huge! Every time we think we've seen everything, we walk in to a new and unexplored room.

A really great way to spend an afternoon in Madison.

I have lived in Madison for several years, but only recently checked out the Chazen while showing some family around town. What a great surprise! I hadn't expected much; it's a small free campus-based museum, but we actually spent a couple of hours in here. Great exhibits and a few pieces that made me stop and stare for a while. I'd highly recommend.

I have been to the Chazen many times to see the free art. They have great rotating collections and visiting artists throughout the year. They do give tours for groups as well. I have been on one of their tours. I highly suggest that you take a tour. The guides are very knowledgeable and will ask if the group wants to see anything in particular. I think the tour took about an hour from start to finish. One of the guys on my tour asked a lot of questions and the tour guide was able to keep up with him even! I was super impressed. The museum is always very clean and well organized. The variety of art in the museum is very diverse. There seems to be a little bit of everything for everyone. It's a great place to take the kids also.

Color me impressed, Chazen! I could not believe how much quality, beautiful art was at this museum. As I walked through the museum I told my friend, "If they have a Picasso I'll be amazed." Maybe 50 ft later - Picasso. There was no cost for entry and they provided free coat/bag storage. I will definitely go back and I strongly suggest all art lovers check it out as well!
The exhibits and rotating galleries are always well thought-out and interesting.  It's never a boring trip when you go to the Chazen! Professional staff and the museum is always extremely clean.

name: University of Wisconsin Geology Museum
address: 1215 W Dayton St, Madison, WI 53706, USA
reviews: Small but fun, they had nice exhibits set up. The dinosaur bones were really cool! The information by each area explaining what everything was was really great. The different stones and minerals all over were really cool to look at. The florescent light room was a great touch as well. I'd definitely make a trip back there again sometime.

Well displayed minerals and geological stuff with well detailed information regarding each specimen kept over in simple terms. Situation within walking distance from downtown. Best part is it's totally free to visit and open for photography. Staff is also very nice and cooperative if you need any information on specific thing.

What a treat to find this museum! Excellent interpretive signage accompanies a small but FANTASTIC collection. I only wish we had given ourselves more than hour to see the exhibit. As a bivalve biologist I was particularly taken by the clam and oyster fossils. And it's FREE!

What a cool "small" museum on campus! (They have two full sized skeletons of prehistoric creatures...so it's not that "small") My son (he's 4) LOVES rocks and so this place is pretty much his dream. There's SO many cool rocks displayed and you can even peek in on researchers in the lab! I'm seriously impressed!

Wow what a hidden treasure. This is a small museum. It is amazing though. There is great rocks. There is a wide variety. Go outside and use the map to figure out where rocks are located in an outdoor little, peaceful area. Best: free! Bring cash if you want to buy a small rock souvenir.

name: Wisconsin Veterans Museum
address: 30 W Mifflin St, Madison, WI 53703, USA
reviews: Took my son here on a field trip and it was a fun place.  They have a nice selection of historical artifacts and weaponry.  The prices were pretty fair too.  Definitely a must-visit.
Nice setup with realistic dioramas. Covers Wisconsin military history from Civil War to Modern. Has real aircraft and field gun on display. Awesome actual submarine periscope to see outside

Had been meaning to visit for years a small, but well put together collection, focusing on Wisconsin, and it's military contributions to our country. Great gift shop as well, I highly recommend. Also the Wisconsin State Historical Museum is across the street.
They have done ALOT with a small space. We went for drink n draw: so cool! Plus drinks! The museum is a 4, but the event made it a 5!
Free. Very organized. Took a guided tour with my daughters 5th grade class. Very informative! The displays are Great! Life like! No parking, find a ramp just off Carroll Street.

name: National Mustard Museum
address: 7477 Hubbard Ave, Middleton, WI 53562, USA
reviews: It is a free museum in Middleton that gives free taste tests and has a mustard gift shop. What's not to love? It was a very playful museum with some interactive parts that were a lot of fun. I highly suggest making this stop any day they are open. Loved it!
nice area to hang out and dine, you may as well stop in and try one of the many many mustards.

So fun!  The museum is small, but packed with fun facts and mustard memorabilia. Admission is free but donations are appreciated. The store offers tastings of pretty much every mustard there, and of course you will certainly find something wonderful to take home.
This place is so nice and creative. Love the Museum in the basement and will be going back again.  It has all your mustard needs in one stop.   Great place to find a gift nobody would be thinking of.

It is a fascinating and quirky museum with mustard from around the world plus a wall of mustards from every single state. The best part is that you can try several highlighted flavors and buy ones that you may otherwise not have access to in any local store. I highly recommend this as a fun visit with kids or friends.

name: Vilas Park
address: 702 S Randall Ave, Madison, WI 53715, USA
reviews: This is a nice park. Its most special thing is that it is adjoined with the zoo of the same name. Don't get me wrong by not giving it 5 stars. I just feel that we shouldn't give 5 to everything just to make sure it's fine. It is a larger park and has at least one playground for young kids. It also has a few ponds for ambience. It has one baseball diamond and has volleyball areas as well. Enjoy lunch at the park and follow it with a visit to the zoo for a great family day.

This place is an incredible, little gem! It’s nestled nicely in Madison and surrounded by beauty. It’s an amazing attraction to take the kids to or just anywhere in general. It’s free and has plenty of stuff to do. There is a suggested two dollar donation and there’s a few donation boxes around the zoo. 
Vilas Park is one of my personal favourite ways to spend a whole afternoon. There more than the zoo inside this park but that’s what makes it amazing!
Nice zoo, especially for young kids. Its clean, not too big and FREE! Great place to spend half a day or so. Take your time and enjoy.

This is one of the better free zoo's that I have been to. Been many times and have always enjoyed it.  We were in Madison recently and I saw that they had Christmas lights at the zoo, after dark.  It was so amazing. Highly recommend stopping anytime,  but if you get the chance check out the Christmas lights

It's completely free, and even in the winter season it's still entertaining. Sometimes I find it hard for me to see any large animal in captivity and not where they belong in nature. Although is zoo is still a great place to observe and learn about foreign wild animals as well as domestic.

name: Allen Centennial Garden
address: 620 Babcock Dr, Madison, WI 53706, USA
reviews: This is a hidden gem on the UW campus. It’s a beautiful place to take a walk, sit on a bench, and relax. The flowers are stunning in spring, summer and fall. Entrance is free, but donations help maintain the beautiful landscape. I would definitely recommend for a cute date spot!

I attended a work wellness event at the Allen Centennial Gardens. What a fantastic resource on the UW-Madison campus that is free to everyone who wants to learn more about this garden and plants in general. I have been to this cute garden a hand full of times in the past, but have never taken a formal tour of it. I'm so glad that I took a tour!

In the ~45 minute tour, I learned so much about plants, general landscaping designs, our changing environment, agriculture in Wisconsin, bees and the beautiful historic home on the garden grounds.

The gardens are absolutely free to the public and also can be rented out for events (ie weddings, photo opportunities, etc). They also host quite a few events during the year also. They have a really nice website where their events (most are free) are posted.

The historic home is under construction currently and is not open for viewing. It sounds as though the home will be closed for an undetermined amount of time still. Once finished, it will host environmentally friendly campus organizations.  

They have quite a few different gardens to walk through or sit in to enjoy a little longer. The walkways are paved and easy to maneuver through. There's lots of seating throughout to enjoy the gardens. I love the water features and their relaxing sounds. The koi pond was probably my favorite spot. They were anxiously awaiting us to drop some food into the water and would follow us as we circumnavigated around the waters edge.

Celebrating 30 years June 2019, stunning gardens!  Multiple styles in one setting to include container, rock, woodland, English - crazy variety of hostas along with a Koi pond, lovely shade trees and various spots to sit and enjoy.
Allen Centennial Garden is awesome! It shows a huge variety of plants from different environments.
Great UW-Madison landmark showcasing beauty and quiet.

name: Wisconsin Historical Museum
address: 30 N Carroll St, Madison, WI 53703, USA
reviews: I visited the Wisconsin Historical Museum to see the Ever Gleam exhibit showcasing their assortment of aluminum Christmas trees. The exhibit was pretty small, but it was interesting to see some of the history of them. I didn't realize that this was their 60th year on display for the holidays. The exhibits rotate through. Check their website for events.

Very interesting. Many items were conversation starters with my brother. You have to see the picture made from hair. SO intricate!! 

Am excited to visit again when they move into the new building. There should be so much more to see. The staff was very informative, friendly, and kind.
Great place. For floors. A lot of things for kids to touch. Great Indian history. No admission fee. Just donations.

A wonderful free (with recommended donation) museum! I've lived most of my life in Wisconsin, so learning more about the history of this great state was a treat. The extensive exhibit about the Native Americans was fascinating, along with the exploration into the political history of the state. Highly recommended!
Cool museum with lots for historical artifacts from the great state of Wisconsin

name: Warner Park
address: 2930 N Sherman Ave, Madison, WI 53704, USA
reviews: Wonderful prices. Even my mom at 88 wants to go back as the announcer makes it fun. Catches kids attention as Many side show events tht are amusing; even chooses the audience members to join in like; baby crawls, throwing balls N many more at each game
This park is beautiful. There are trails to wander on, the Mallards Stadium, nice areas for the kids to play, and it was just a pleasant experience.
My grandkids love to come here so we enjoy

Absolutely the best place to take the kids for a baseball game! There's something for everyone! Activities for kids and adults; giveaways throughout the entire game; donations to charities; and all kinds of things to keep everyone involved, from bouncing giant baseballs throughout the stands to throwing free goodies up into the seats and lots and lots of music. Fun time!

A great park with so much to offer! Mallards Stadium, East High football games, little leagues, softball, soccer field, walking and biking paths, community center, multicolored shelter, play equipment, basketball court and some scenic views. Hope you like it too!

name: Madison Museum of Contemporary Art
address: 227 State St, Madison, WI 53703, USA
reviews: Fascinating, thought provoking, reflection inducing, carefully curated art open to the public free of charge.  A wonderful service and a remarkable opportunity.

The staff was very informative. Nice place to spend some time without spending money. They had a couple really nice exhibitions I would have been fine spending money to see, the quality was fantastic.

I collaborated with the museum on a February styled shoot and I was so pleased with my experience! It offers such a gorgeous, bright and open wedding space. The staff were so polite, organized and accommodating! It was a pleasure working with them!

Beautiful space surrounded by glass walls.  Collection includes many different styles of art including many media.  Displayed with appropriate space and light.  Spent an hour appreciating the three major galleries.  Convenient location at the Overture Center in downtown Madison.
A beautiful building in downtown Madison, highlighting a diverse array of contemporary and local art. Well worth a visit! And it's free! (But you should leave a donation of you can.)

name: Olbrich Botanical Gardens
address: 3330 Atwood Ave, Madison, WI 53704, USA
reviews: I truly love this place! I've been going there since I was born and now take my children there. I love seeing all the beautifully maintained gardens. It's such an enjoyable place to visit! I love that it's basically free but always give a nice donation because I really enjoy visiting! I'm sure I'll be coming back for years to come!

Wonderful place for all seasons!

Winter: Go inside and check out their conservatory featuring various exotic birds, plants, and trees. This place is sure to cure your winter blues.

Any other season: Check our the botanical gardens and see all the various plants and landscaping they incorporate into their flawless layout.

Very inexpensive date idea, typical time it takes to walk around is 1-2 hours.

Feburary is Orchid month at the dome. Stepping into the indoor tropical garden is just what the doctor ordered for subzero winter blues. The tiny birds flying around and the quail on the ground add a lively element.  We can't wait until the spring when the enormous outdoor garden starts to bloom. The gift store has some very pretty souvenirs. I especially like the Wisconsin themed alphabet book. B is for Badger of course.

Excellent winter time activity for the whole family.  Attractive and lively garden center with train and holiday display to visit in addition to the conservatory.  Gardens still had some plants to see despite the cold weather and the stroll through the outside paths made for good exercise.  The indoor conservatory transports the visitor to a tropical paradise and allows for an educational walk with flowers, plants and birds not available in Madison.  

Construction of the new educational facilities in ongoing.  Will be a fantastic set of buildings when completed.

Easy to borrow a scooter for people with mobility challenges.    Holiday Cafe set out for refreshments.

Went here for the orchid show in Jan or Feb of 2020. Glad to see flowers in Winter.  The building was stuffed full and packed with people.  Lighting in the lecture-room with the sloped glass roof needs to be updated from old big fixtures. First time they're looking forward to going back in better weather.

name: Escape This
address: 120 E Wilson St #2, Madison, WI 53703, USA
reviews: The staff here was very helpful and prompt with responding to questions and recommendations of dining options nearby.  The escape room puzzle was fun and entertaining. The only mishap we had with our puzzle is that one item opened with an incorrect code somehow which threw off our ability to complete the entire puzzle correctly. The staff person was very apologetic and assured us the item would be reset correctly for the next time around. We would recommend ‘Escape This’ to other groups.
Such a fun bonding experience... awesome puzzles and games in the rooms! Great gamekeeper to help keep you on track.

Alright, this was a lot of fun. Sherlock room so I can't speak to the other one but this was fairly tough. I think having done one we might be able to figure out the next one, but this was a good challenge.

I brought a group of 12 here. We initially planned to do the lost Friday night room, but the host here suggested we switch over to the Sherlocked room which was available. This was a great suggestion. We took almost all the allotted time to complete this challenge. It was well paced and well themed. Overall had a great experience, and everyone in the group was able to get involved. This was a moderately challenging room, so experience helps.
Only issue is I wish the first half was as hands on and physical as part two

name: Escape In Time - Escape Rooms
address: 6527 Normandy Ln UNIT 203, Madison, WI 53719, USA
reviews: From the initial entrance of trying to find your way in, to finally getting the serum in 8min to spare. Bunker 57 was a great way to spend our evening for my daughters birthday!  Start to finish it was a rush of survival! Never done anything like this before and had an amazing night! So much fun we already bought tickets for our next adventure!

Great time! The room was a blast, and I loved how emersed into the story I felt. The room(s) where convincing. Other escape rooms have not been done as well, still hints of being in a regular room. But not here. I would deffinatly reccomend!!!

Right away, we had a malfunction in our room (our door got physically stuck), so the game master gave us permission to move onto the next step (even though we solved the clue). It definitely killed the mood. There are NOT enough tasks for a group of 8 to do at the same time. There was AT LEAST 2 of us standing to the side at any given time doing absolutely nothing. The room we were in was also unnecessarily dark. So much so, that we missed part of the game play and the game master chimed in because we couldn't see the item in question. While it killed a good hour of time, it was not worth $30. I was not entertained. I would not visit again. The group sizes need to shrink or they need to add more components/steps to the escaping prices, even if they're not critical to the actual escape and are more "side quests" - just something to keep everyone busy. Be aware, our room was also quite chilly.

Overall, Escape in Time heavily invests in aesthetics and lacks in content. The aesthetics are very impressive, the only upside to this location. However, our group of four purposely chose their "most-difficult" room, Cyrosleep. The room lacked sufficient puzzles to keep everyone moving and often had multiple people standing around waiting till one person was able to plug in a code. The puzzles were very linear and not challenging. We escaped with 19 minutes left and were disappointed. We were expecting atleast another room to move into. The designs and displays were intriguing but we left feeling like we completed half a room. There was no rush or adrenaline or sense of emergency. Not going to return to this escape room.
We had a really fun (if nerve-chilling) time escaping from the "Eat or Be Eaten" room with 8 seconds to spare! It is a perfect room for this time of year with Halloween coming up. 😁

name: Tenney Park
address: 402 N Thornton Ave, Madison, WI 53703, USA
reviews: What a beautiful spot! Feel free to fish, hike, take a leisurely walk, and NO SWIMMING. This is a beautiful spot for some professional photos because of the beautiful bridge here. When I went, I saw some people painting outside, and thought, 'what a great idea!'

Beautiful park. Nice waterways, including historic bridges. Lots of rain gardens with pollinators. There's a beach and boardwalk with a lighthouse. There are public restrooms near one of the playgrounds (by the lake) and another by the locks. Lots of tennis courts.
Beautiful spot to walk, swing, swim, fish and more. You can watch the boats go through the lock. Fabulous place to watch the sunset.

Tenney park and locks is an essential element of Madison. An excellent place to shore fish, the park is also a very nice place for a walk or run anytime. Good neighborhood, quite safe. Try ice skating at the pond during the winter, can be a great time.
Great service! Surprisingly functional on a snowy day! Bring your own shovel!

name: Aldo Leopold Nature Center
address: 330 Femrite Dr, Monona, WI 53716, USA
reviews: A great nature refuge in the city. There are several paths to explore including a small pond. There are not landscaped as in a park but simple rugged paths. In the building, they provide a variety of classes and activities. The building is handicap accessible however, the paths are rough. (The staff is very helpful and I suspect that if you contacted them in advance some accommodations would be made - but the paths are rough.)

Beautiful nature center located just outside the city! They've got a lovely prairie full of diverse plant life, squirrels and a wide array of birds including a nesting pair of sandhill cranes. There's a nice array of trails through the nature park and inside there's an awesome exhibit of climate and the earth, including two very cool movie presentations in unique little theaters.
Beautiful place.  I went there for my first time with my daughter to attend a birthday party.   Anyone who has never visited must check it out.

I am a first grade teacher. Yesterday I took my students to Aldo Leopold Nature Center for the Pioneer Days program they offer. It was so wonderful!! They do such a fabulous job with the kids; the docents lead well and are so kind to the students! We had Miss Grace and Miss Katherine yesterday and they were phenomenal!  The Pioneer Days program is full of hands-on activities. This was my fourth year taking a class and I have yet to be disappointed!
Beautiful nature get away, nor far from the city. It's the perfect little escape. I love just walking aimlessly on the trails

name: Elver Park
address: 1250 McKenna Blvd, Madison, WI 53719, USA
reviews: Enjoyed a lot the Winter Festival, Madison. It was free. Ski materials are available on rent. Great place for sledding too.

This park was quite an enjoyable experience for my son, 5 y, and me. We essentially went on an adventure exploring the park, and decide to walk through a *portal* we found at the park 🤔😳😎 into a whole new world. There, we explored the world through the imagination of my son which was so much fun. We essentially found our way back through the portal onto Earth 😁🤩☺️.

The park is quite clean. There's disc golf for a small cost. It's a great place for a walk or jog. We definitely will be coming back soon for another adventure 😎.

This place has everything for every season! Ice rink, with skate rentals to relax in the cool air. Sledding hills for the rush of cold air in the face. Cross country skiing for a great workout with great trails. That's just winter!!!

Summertime has disc golf, splash park, and great hiking trails!

If you like being outdoors, you'll like Elver Park!
Very nice park, brand new playground and a very popular disc golf course. There is a splash pad for the kiddos too! Very family friendly 👪👍
Elver Park is a great place to ski, snow shoe and ice skate in the winter, good summer stuff too. Lots of hills so its fun.

name: Picnic Point
address: University of Wisconsin Madison, 2000 University Bay Dr, Madison, WI 53705, USA
reviews: Absolutely stunning. It is like you are far away in vacation but you are in the middle of Madison. Awesome i think i found my happy place
Gorgeous location.  Well maintained trail with a few fire pits along it.  They provide wood near them.

Picnic Point is one of the more special places in Madison. Now only a walking trail, with several (reservable) fire pits along the way, and a large one at the tip, it's a beautiful walk through a wooded, wildflower-strewn landscape with water on both sides. A spectacular view of the University and downtown Madison. And a spectacular sunset vista the opposite way. Truly a great walk but bikes are no longer allowed.

I go here all the time, great place to walk, meet people, hangout, see a sunrise, just all around great place. The trails are spacious and views are amazing one of the best places in Madison hands down. If you are lucky enough to wake up for a sunrise it's definitely worth it. It's kept clean, and well maintained. Definitely recommend you to go here
This place means so much to me! Such a peaceful place where amazing sights can be seen and amazing people congregate.

name: Wisconsin Governor's Mansion
address: 99 Cambridge Rd, Madison, WI 53704, USA
reviews: We attended an event here. It was well organized, the grounds were lovely, and Governer Evers and his wife were incredibly friendly. Thank you for a great experience!
It's nice to be welcomed in the People's home again!
Go in the summer when you can enjoy the view of the lake! Beautiful property!
Beautiful house on the lake. Staff was knowledgeable and friendly. Quick walk-through with plenty of opportunities to ask questions.
Beautifully decorated Governor's Mansion.  All real evergreen trees were used throughout the residence.

name: Pheasant Branch Conservancy
address: 4864 Pheasant Branch Rd, Middleton, WI 53562, USA
reviews: Pheasant Branch is absolutely lovely! I've enjoyed every experience I've had hiking there, and my dog has as well. It's one of the few Madison parks or hiking areas where I have never seen anyone violate leash laws with their dog, which is absolutely wonderful. A great place to go spend some time outdoors!

Great walking route! the whole route is pretty long, but there are many exits you can come out from. If you drove here, you would have to go back to where you parked. You can also hear a lot of woodpeckers

Trails are marked well and maintained. Porta potty available at the Middleton Orchid Heights location. Various trails available for ability levels. Some paved, boardwalks keep travelers above marshy areas, mostly gravel. Park expansion in progress. Please check website for progress.
So Beautiful!  I went hiking on a sunny, fall afternoon, and it was quite busy with couples and families of all ages. Everyone was helpful and in jolly spirits. An enjoyable afternoon!

If you guys want to bike ride or want to take a free relaxing walk you can go this park. It is calm and quit. So many plants surrounded by you. There is a bubble spring,flowers and a long trail you can walk on. There is also a park. The park is fun to play in. You guys should try this place out whenever you want to play outside.

name: Olbrich Park Beach
address: 3527 Atwood Ave, Madison, WI 53714, USA
reviews: Can't beat the sunsets on this west facing local beauty. LOVE Madison... Let's get these lakes clean though!

Olbrich Gardens is exceptionally beautiful, expensive and very affordable. It’s a wonderful place for families, couples and singles. I love how the back open air gardens are absolutely free, and the Thai Pavilion is an absolute gem of the city of Madison. Can’t wait to go back!!

The place is beautiful, went with my family in vacation, since I have a Nikon camera they made me pay $31.00 for a permit as photographer, they didn't care when I told them that my family and me are visiting and that the photos taken were for personal use and memories to share, like other people who visited that day. Told the person that I could put away the camera in my bag, but didn't let me, and insisted in me leaving it with him, so I accepted leaving the camera, and ask for a ticket, the person told me that it was good and didn't need a ticket. So I paid since I don't trust that way of the facility, made me fill some paper that mention me as a photographer in an event or photo shooting.

One of the nicest public gardens in the Midwest. Take time for a peaceful break in your day and go enjoy the simple beauty of this city Oasis. It's even pretty in the winter after a fresh snowfall. We all need to stop and smell the roses!

Absolutely stunning outdoor gardens! The whole place seems to be run by sweet, old women and the best part is that it's free! There is also a small conservatory indoors that you can see for a small fee. Very friendly staff, lovely gift shop. 10/10 would recommend. Also seems like a beautiful place to get married, wink wink.

name: Olin Park
address: 1156 Olin-Turville Ct, Madison, WI 53715, USA
reviews: This is the Olin park at night during the holiday season. The electrician union of Madison makes an exemplary display of holiday lights. Of course there are multiple companies that sponsor this event as well. A good place to have a picnic or go for a quick run.

Grounds maintained nicely, easy to reserve event space in the enclosed pavilion for gatherings large & small. Stunning view of WI State Capital looking across the lake which borders the inland perimeter of park. Nice boat launch access with concrete traction bars leading in & out of piers for optimal traction control whether launching or retrieving boats.
We loved seeing the Holiday Fantasy in Lights display at Olin Park tonight.  The many light displays were  creative and clever. I  urge everyone to see this.

I had enjoyed viewing this beautiful light show last night. The light show would be running until 1/4/20. I would suggest everyone to have a view of the beautiful light show. 
-free admission
-drive thru

Merry Christmas 🎄☃️🎅
They finally changed it around this year with some new additions! Kids loved it and the channel played Christmas music! Thanks for having this free light show.

name: Old Sugar Distillery
address: 931 E Main St #8, Madison, WI 53703, USA
reviews: We booked a distillery tour and tasting. It was mostly a tasting but we enjoyed it. Our guide was knowledgeable and friendly. Had a good variety of cocktails. Mostly dark liquor.

Great products, make fantastic gifts. Nice interesting interior. Strong drinks and some interesting cocktails. They have outdoor seating during summer months. Service is not the best; been there countless times and never gotten any better. Might be due to being short-staffed or something. I recommend you order your next drink before you finish the one you are drinking to minimize wait time. Be prepared to wait for that great drink. They have snacks like cheese and sausage/cured meats; they are pretty good. Once you get a drink in your hand, its a good time!
Went here for a cocktail or two with some friends and knew it would become a favorite! Delicious drinks, friendly bartenders, and such a cool space!

High quality distillery with great cocktails, friendly staff and a beautiful space. Great patio for the warmer months (good dog friendly!), and perfect hangout inside in the winter. Sometimes they have really great live music, too!
Not impressed. The whiskey tasted too young. There was not a gin option. Brandy was ok.

name: James Madison Park
address: 614 E Gorham St, Madison, WI 53703, USA
reviews:
This is a great summer time park, huge grass lawn with playground and volley ball court and basketball courts. 
Last few summers the beach has been closed from blue green algae but that's nut the parks fault! Highly recommend of you want to go to a big wide open park.
My favorite place that I visit during my travel to visit my daughter in Madison. It is a nice serene place, calm and cool as well as neat and clean. Well kept park by the authorities.
It's ok as far as parks go, local hangout with access to Lake Mendota. Basketball court, play area for kids, limited street parking. Summer it's busy.
Wonderful, lake-front park in downtown Madison WI. Lots of open space

The most beautiful and relaxing spot Downtown Madison through the summer. Not very crowded during the weekend. It has a cute kids area and small beach. The place is suitable for kayaking, brunch, barbecue,volleyball game.

name: B.B. Clarke Beach Park
address: 835 Spaight St, Madison, WI 53703, USA
reviews: One of Madison's great beaches! The sand and swimming area are what you'd expect, although it gets deeper quicker than, say, Vilas. If you pass a simple swimming test you can swim out to the float and diving board. The grassy slope from the street down to the water makes this a wonderful park for picnics, hanging out and people watching, reading, or a nap in the shade.

First Visit June 8th 2018
PARK INFORMATION - GREAT 1ST TIME VISIT

PARK HOURS:  4am - 10pm

LIFEGUARD on Duty 11am - 6pm
      Hired by the city of Madison

RESTROOMS:  Available lifeguard hours

HANDICAP ACCESSIBLE - NO 
       * See comment bottom

PARKING:  On the street above the park.  
        The park is located at the base of a small
         hill.  There is a bike/walking trail to 
         access before using wooden steps 
         to get to the beach area.  Benches line
         This walk area to oversee the park and 
         Viewing area.  Very pretty. 

FOOD/DRINK:  None,  bring along

BEACH:  Sand was freshly grated/clean
     great for building with sand toys
     (bring along) and walking/sitting

SWIMMING:  Buoyed area for safety 
       Diving board area for those interested

ATMOSPHERE:  Refreshing area,  not large  
        Just right for a day at the beach. 
        Playground equipment right by water
        Easy to keep watch of children safely 
        View over Lake Monona,  City of Madison
        Residential neighborhood

*HANDICAP COMMENT - NO, But not impossible if by use of boat landing.  Not sure how to access it or if locked.  Right next to bathroom building and beach area.  Otherwise the park is on a slanted hill looking down from the road making it a challenge.
Love this beach. Great for swimming. Try to get there early in the season before the blue-green algae moves in.
Swimming area, lifeguards, place to sun yourself -standard, lovely for an afternoon.
Great place for fun & swimming or water sports

name: Warner Park Dog Park
address: 2301 Sheridan Dr, Madison, WI 53704, USA
reviews: Such a beautiful day for the dog park! Love walking by the water
Always a lot of dogs here. My dogs love it! There's trails and water access for my dogs to swim. The people that come here are always really nice too
Two huge fields, woods with squirrels to chase, and a doggie beach make this the best dog park in Madison!  Also has a separate fenced area for small, shy, or older pups.
Very fun place to walk around, my friends and me tried sledding down the hill on a card board box it didnt work that well. I would recommend this park.

This is my favorite dog park in Madison, and my dogs love to visit too. I love that there is one long path and a smaller enclosed area for older dogs. I have to keep my Springer away from the water though - it's way too muddy!

name: Governor Nelson State Park
address: 5140 County Highway M, Waunakee, WI 53597, USA
reviews: Great park in the winter of summer.  The beach is great place to relax with the family.

We enjoy this park for hiking, pick nicking and the play ground. The park is never very busy and they have carts to use to haul things to the park area. Nice mix of trails that are through the woods and prairie. You do have to watch carefully when hiking since the trails aren't marked great. We enjoy the park area for the view of the water and Madison. Also like all the shade and breeze, perfect for relaxing or a picnic.

Great place to see butterflies and birds. Three of us saw 2000 monarchs on migration on 9/15/19.  This photo was taken right across from the building at the entrance. The prairie trail is suitable for a powered scooter.
Cute little park on lake Mendota. Bring a picnic and enjoy the view of the capital

There is plenty of parking. Entrance fee is steep ($8 or $11/ day if you are resident or non resident). They do have annual passes as well. The park has a lot of potential, but could use some TLC. Infrastructure is crumbling. Beach area isn't that well upkept. Beach was full of green sludge. You can see downtown Madison and there is a boat launch available. Mosquitoes and bugs can be bad. There are plenty of trails through tall grass where you can see plenty of pollinators. There otherwise isn't that much to see

name: Orton Park
address: 1103 Spaight St, Madison, WI 53703, USA
reviews: This was my childhood playground! Great big park with lots of trees, basketball court and gazebo. Even space for a baseball or kickball game!

Orton Park fesitval.  Another great  park in Madison with free music festival.  We wemt for 2 days.  1st happy hour on Friday half price beer and wine and great music from Slow Pulp.  Saturday stopped in after bike ride around the lake.
Orton Park is another excellent City of Madison park, very clean and beautiful. Orton park fest is one of the oldest city festivals at 40+ years. Certainly a great festival to attend.

Tall trees. Has a kiosko. Lake is pretty close
Nice playground
Nice park with playground, gazebo, and lots of green space. Basketball court, lots of benches in a lovely neighborhood. Shaded playground area is nice in the summer.

name: Olbrich Park
address: 3527 Atwood Ave, Madison, WI 53714, USA
reviews: We had a fun time at this little biergarden in Madison. There are a bunch of picnic tables, a few games to play (a big Jenga set, some sandy volleyball courts nearby) and even a small beach to hang out on. The day we visited was a bit overcast and drizzly but we still had a good time. As the evening got later, the small hanging lights in the area came on and created a sweet atmosphere. They had a number of beers to choose from and even came in a reusable plastic mug. Though the area is small it's worth checking out because it has great views of the lake and easy parking.

Olbrich is a beautiful place to walk, play, swim, or just sit in the nearby beer garden (or not) and enjoy a gorgeous sunset over our lovely capital city.
There is a lot of space for pretty much anything you'd like to do. 
Enjoy!!!
Nice park by the lake.
Very peaceful place with natural garden and bundle of different flower trees .. love it

Nice park on the lake with a beach, multiple boat launches, and canoe/kayak rentals.  Lots of space so pretty spread out along Atwood.  The beer garden was a good place to hang out.  Botanical gardens looked nice.

name: Yahara Place Park
address: 2025 Yahara Pl, Madison, WI 53704, USA
reviews: One if the better lake side parks surrounding Lake Mendota. Has a legit playground, volleyball court, and although it's not incredibly wide it's big enough to throw a frisbee without fear of it going in the street.
Very beautiful.

Lakefront featival with friends. Great music and Free.  2 days of live music with some good bands.  Neil Francis and his Hammond B3.  They travel gig to gig with the organ.  Nice.  ERic Mcfadden from New orleans.  Loved his song writing and music.  The festival stull has long lines for food and beer, but the music is free and the weather was nice.
Nice waterfront park, older play structure and volleyball net. Great festival in early June.
Very nice, LowKey spot.

name: Lakeview Park
address: 6300 Mendota Ave, Middleton, WI 53562, USA
reviews: It's a very beautiful park. A big facility for kids to play, a huge shelter and a few grills. You can also bring your own grill, like us. We had a great time cooking there two weeks ago.

One of the best parks in the area! It offers so much to do. It has two play areas, bathrooms, a splash pad that's open in the summer, a lake that you can fish in, and a short walking trail around the lake. My kids never get bored here and it offers a wide variety for all ages!
Nice splash park for the kids, pond for fishing, path for walking, and shelters for parties
Great park and memorial piece! Lots of parking, shelter area, and courts. Kids area is pretty significant in size. Great park for kids.
Super fun! Beautiful walking trail with exercise equipment! I'll be back!

name: Crawdaddy Cove Indoor Water Park
address: 1109 Fourier Dr, Madison, WI 53717, USA
reviews: We booked the facility for a first birthday party that we’ll be having in March. We tested it out to see how much our 6 month old would love it earlier and she had a blast!  Small enough to not be overwhelming but still plenty of fun for kids of all ages. She loved going down the slide with daddy and enjoyed the bubbling water features. The birthday room we selected for the part overlooks the pool and should be perfect for food, cake and presents. The package also includes pizza and soda. Such a fun place for the kids! :)

Our little guy has a blast with his buddy. The adults loved the big slide and the hot tub. Since most visitors have a room, the bathroom and changing facilities are minimal -- too minimal for a visitor who is not also an overnight guest. I can imagine that might be an issue for anyone who has to check out on the day they visit the facility. That was my only knock on the place. We had a great time.

A nice place to take your younger kids. Could definitely use a little updating but all in all we had a good experience. I definitely suggest looking online for deals to this hotel prior to booking because there are definitely some good deals out there!

Don't expect Dells quality facilities. But it will do. Kids like it. It's definitely not maintained super well, but good enough. Big pool was closed while we were there due to "contamination" (ie: kid pooped in the pool). Have gone to a birthday party there, which was fun. Again, if you're not expecting Dells quality water park/hotel, then you will be fine. It works for what you want it to. Employees were very friendly.

I would rate between a 3 or 4. The hotel is under construction for updates. We will be back again because for the 4 year old it was the perfect size. However for the 16 year old not so much to do in the eater park. One slide and basketball hoop. The slide isn't that large. For a mini getaway it was nice. Hopefully it will get better with the updates.  Our room was clean the lobby area was clean. The restroom in the waterpark needed to be cleaned.

name: McKee Farms Park
address: 2930 Chapel Valley Rd, Fitchburg, WI 53711, USA
reviews: A bit cold, but still fun for the kids. Restrooms are closed for the winter and water fountains are off.
McKee Farms, hosted the Festival Italia in June 2019. The park is spacious, well groomed, has  a nice pavilion for parties, and also a great water sprinkler park for children.
Lots of parking, hosts a lot of fun events. Great amenities. Lots of Pokestops and gyms for players of Pokemon Go. Worth checking out!
Wide and good breathtaking park:)

My kids enjoyed the slides and playing with others’ pets. I enjoyed the view and the friendly people out there. Diversity is noticed and it’s good to meet people from different backgrounds. It enriches our culture. Observed 2 birthday parties with lovely music

name: Washburn Observatory
address: 1401 Observatory Dr, Madison, WI 53706, USA
reviews: Perfect place for a date night if you love science and space. On Wednesday's in the summer you can go for free and look through their telescope. the location is great, on top of a hill with a view of Lake Mendota, lots of walking paths nearby and a bike lane.

Washburn Observatory is the original research observatory for the University of Wisconsin (Madison) astronomy department. Completed in 1881, it is of significant historical value though its active research days are far behind it. From the historic Clark refracted located inside to the picturesque dome-on-the-hill, Washburn is a great place for a visit when you're in Madison.
A great resource. Definitely stop by on one of the open-house evenings. Much fun gazing through the refurbished telescope and observatory. Support science!
Loved it.. Sign up for tweets to know if its open.  We saw Jupiter the night we went.  Its can be a long walk depending where you are starting from...
Neat building, they have a cool library.

name: Winnequah Park
address: Gazebo Nichols Rd & near Winnequah Road, Monona, WI 53716, USA
reviews: Who equal park has a quaint lagoon and gazebo that is picture perfect in any season. In the warmer months, the MY Dream Park is an amazing labyrinth of fun for all ages. I was in elementary school and got to help design the park many years ago!!

Near public library Nice neighborhood park on Lake Monona near Madison, WI. Playground, picnic area, tennis courts, and municipal building. Hosts various events during the year. Was here for annual Lake Monona 20k/5k race. Good time!
Very nice park.  The highlight is a dream park playground that the kids loved.  It has a large wooden structure to climb on and run around.  Two year old and 4 year old loved it.
Great family park. Kids will have fun. Great area. And the pool is right next to it.

My grandson's favorite part. The Dream playground is the best I've seen in a public park. And they host wonderfully executed activities. Ie: the Halloween Egg Hunt and Movie. Plenty of volunteers with friendly face. The event was fun for everyone regardless of very cold and damp weather. Thank you!

name: Owen Conservation Park
address: 6021 Old Sauk Rd, Madison, WI 53705, USA
reviews: Excellent park tucked away, just off of Old Sauk Road. Entrance is on the right hand side of the road, just before the elementary school, as you head down the hill towards Old Middleton Road. Small parking lot with about a dozen parking stalls. Lots of trails with plenty of elevation changes. Would be excellent for trail running.

Owen Park is one of the gems of the Madison Park system. When you were inside of it and on the Prairie restoration portions or around the oak savannas. Or in one of the fern filled valleys of the middle growth deciduous forest You can barely see any of Madison. It is though you go from being in the middle of the city to the country in a matter of roughly 10 second ride in. Great walking paths very good for contemplation and meditation.
Such a nice conservation park in the of residence area, provide for wild life and casual hiking environment.

The prairie is like a painting of purple, yellow, browns and greens in August.  Swallowtail butterflies and monarchs floating over the flowers; tiny hummingbirds are drinking nectar at the beebalms.  Breathtaking!
Lovely park to walk in with several inches of snow. There are several loops to walk which are wide enough for both those on foot and cross country skies.

name: Capital Springs State Recreation Area
address: 3113 Lake Farm Rd, Madison, WI 53711, USA
reviews: Fantastic bike trail. Definitely going back

Such a nice destination so close to Madison. Come by foot bike or car. So much wildlife to view. Peaceful relaxing. Take pictures if you like. Maybe a picnic would be fun. Close to camping. Close to boating and fishing. Bring your whole family to enjoy this gem in Madison.

Seems like nice park. Bathroom clean and big. Pulled in last night, but as i have shore power,  there is mo h2o at the sites. I saw dump station pulling in. Visited this park a couple years ago. Very pretty grasslands. But, as with all the wisconsin State parks, imho,  over priced by a little. 27.00 a night is high. Maybe 25.00 would be more in line. Oh well...ok, found water hookups. Still not worth 27.00.

Nice dog park with a .75 mile gravel path,  plus lots of unofficial paths and mowed or wild prairie grass areas. Limited shade in the summer,  but they are building a shelter for 2018. Poop  bags provided,  but bring your own water.
Very large dog park often filled with great dogs and people. It actually has twists and turns, as well as hills and topography; not just a flat, open field with a fence.

name: Garner (Harrison) Park
address: 333 S Rosa Rd, Madison, WI 53705, USA
reviews: A wonderful medium sized park on Madisons west side.  Room for a few soccer fields below near the basketball court.  Up top near the really cool shelter are tennis courts.  There are also several trails to walk through and around the park.  There is also a softball area in the lower right side if your at the top of the park looking down.  Also home to a few wild turkeys that you will see from time to time.

Excellent park! Very spacious and lots of amenities. Small parking lot at the main park entrance that can fit approximately 20 cars. Plenty of street-side parking though. Large pavillion, soccer fields, basketball courts, a volleyball court, tennis courts, and a baseball field. Lots of connecting paved paths throughout the park. Occasionally, they have Opera in the Park here.

Garner Park is a gem in Madison!  It has so many uses.  The tennis courts have been converted to pickleball and now serve many active residents.  Lessons are available through the summer months.

Opera in the Park is a free event for the community that is held in what is a natural amphitheatre in the Park.  The slope of the sledding hill provides summer seating to a huge crowd, drinking wine, picnicking, and enjoying sublime music from Madison Opera.

The natural prairie is lovely in all four seasons, providing cover for a variety of birds and wildlife.  The Madison Parks Department has recently upgraded the paths and roads within the park to make it very accessible.  Playground equipment is available and well used by neighborhood children and visitors alike.
Good sledding hill. Not too steep, not too short. Won't send you to the hospital like Elver but big enough to be satisfying.
Nice & quiet place. Lots of space to roam around in. People play pickle ball here.

name: Prairie Moraine County Park
address: 1970 County Rd Pb, Verona, WI 53593, USA
reviews: Huge dog park with many trails for lots of distance options. Well maintained trails, mostly wood chips with gravel driveway to top of tower hill. Beloved by many, yet never feels crowded because of size of park. I love this park for a great connection with nature for me and great exercise for my pups.
My dog loves coming to the Prairie Moraine park! I enjoy walking the trails while he's making new friends and exploring. Great place to get some exercise!

This place is amazing. It's a big off leash dog park. You dont have to worry about other people not liking dogs while you're here and your dog has so much space to roam and explore. Even with all the cars in the parking lot on a nice Saturday morning, there was more than plenty of running space and trails for all the dogs. Wish there was a place like this closer to our home!
Best park I have ever been to.  You will not find a dog park of this size that is enjoyable for dogs as well as owners looking for a nice walk.
Gorgeous park! Along with the Prairie there is also woods.  A good place to go to relax and enjoy nature.

name: Oscar Rennebohm Park
address: 115 N Eau Claire Ave, Madison, WI 53705, USA
reviews: A beautiful park in Madison. Perfect location for apartment buildings and houses around. There's a tennis court, kids play area, swings slides etc, a gathering center, a jogging, biking track, and beautiful lawn everywhere. Awesome location for my daily strolls and morning walks.

I used to live in a near by apartment and used to go to this park every other day .... I am missing it so much. There is a play ground for kids and tennis courts and beautiful flowers ... every thing you need is there
There is nice playground equipment and a good gazebo that is great for hosting parties and events
Lovely park. Quiet. Clean. Big. Easy access.

One of my favorite parks. There is diversity in the neighborhood and always families there. I feel safe bringing my kids there. I like the slides and structure. The ping pong table is a great touch. The big field is fun to run through on warm summer evenings and the walk around the park is beautiful in autumn with the leaves!

name: Hiestand Park
address: 4302 Milwaukee St, Madison, WI 53714, USA
reviews: Radar Hill. I have been walking this now for several weeks and utilizing the inclines and the declines for proprioceptive training. The snow makes it even more interesting. I'm so glad it's here and within walking distance. It's my new Wisconsin version of my Florida "Primal Playground". Outdoor exercise is better than stuffing yourself inside of a box any day of the week.
Cool park with so many fun things

A great park to go for a walk in or take your dog for a walk in. Usually pretty empty but if the weather is really nice you'll get a lot of Ultimate Frisbee players. It's really well kept and clean, if you're looking for somewhere on the East Side to take a breathe I would suggest stopping here.

Mid level dual basket disc golf course. On the bus line but near the highway if you wanted stop make a pit stop or road trip. Enough of a challenge for all skill levels. Glide disc golf shop is across the road.  It is a pay to play course.
Best disc golf course of the city of Madison! Lots of variety and elevation change.

name: Cherokee Marsh - North Unit
address: 6098 N Sherman Ave, Madison, WI 53704, USA
reviews: This place is magical. You can walk over the marsh in several areas of the park. It's easy to remember the paths after you've ventured through the area a handful of times. There are so many beautiful spots to sit at and enjoy the various views of the marsh. Then, there are cranes all over the place. If you're lucky, you'll get to see them up close at some point during your visit. This place is really well laid out. The bathrooms are very good, for outdoors bathrooms. I was impressed. You can find a map close to the restrooms of the marsh, if you need one. The marsh is free to the public - that's right, you do not have to pay to visit the Cherokee Marsh. I highly recommend this place for hiking. Today it was still snowed over quite a bit. Bring your snow boots/rain boots if your planning on hiking. Things still need to thaw out.
Great place for hike.  They have heated bathrooms for visitors which is amazing.  Its suprising large for being in Madison and the trails are very well care for which makes hiking easy.
Snowy winter hike; scenic, sunny, crunchy; solitude together

The sun was shining and the meadow was gorgeous. It was lovely to get out for a walk. We did a large loop and it was definitely over 3 miles, I'm thinking closer to 4. There are shorter loops options available, but it was so nice out that we wanted to continue.
Cool spot with lots of mini destinations to keep 4 year olds excited. Almost enough wind and sun to keep off the mosquitos

name: Marshall Park
address: 2101 Allen Blvd, Middleton, WI 53562, USA
reviews: A good place for a quick jaunt and be close to the nature. They also have place to take out your boats or kayaks. The restrooms are closed during winters. Not a lot of area that you can walk around the lake though. A good place to have a picnic during the summer time. A lot of open parking space available. Good time to visit is during summer.

Awesome park! Has plenty of parking, lots of areas for family activities (volley ball, fishing, etc), a kid's playground, boat landing, beach, kayak rentals, trails, a small store, and shelter areas with bathrooms. There was also an overlook area where you can look out at the lake and there were people getting their wedding pictures taken there. Very beautiful park overall. Awesome trees!

Great little park to explore, with lots of small trails to hike, and places to sit. Gets a little buggy in the summer, but on a windy day it isn't too bad. There is plenty of parking even for a busy day, and access to the water is plentiful. Docks for little and big boats. Sit on the beach and tan or sit in the shade and have a drink with some friends!
Our favorite fishing spot! Now you can also rent canoes and boats here as well as buy ice cream.  It's a beautiful park and place to grill out

Marshall's is so great. I have the boat membership via Madison Boats and honestly the staff is so incredibly helpful, caring. and friendly. They have got your back whether you are a beginner renter or experienced boater. The lake is beautiful from here and you get a great view of the sailboats. ♡

name: Law Park
address: 410 S Blair St, Madison, WI 53703, USA
reviews: Got tickets to watch Shake the Lake. There was food, drinks, and private seating. The only problem was the trees that blocked the lake. But, I found a spot that was perfect for the show. Watching all the boats lining up on the lake, the lights, and the fireworks was another beautiful night in Madison.

Great little park. The perfect jumping of point for many adventures. Sits on lake shore path, right near Monona Terrace on the west, and machinery row bike shop on the east. Free parking after 6 and on the weekends.
An excellent view of downtown Madison with a great bike path. Views for days. A great spot for one to see the lake front from a distance.
Water ski show was amazing.. Seems to be most Sunday nights in the summer.
Beautiful park on the lakefront

name: Burrows Park
address: 25 Burrows Rd, Madison, WI 53704, USA
reviews: Very peaceful, great place to watch the sunset across the lake
Nice quiet little spot to fish and watch a storm roll in to Madison
Attended a 1 years birthday party in the shelter. Very cute park for a small gathering.
Pulled in to check messages, make some phone calls and relax for a moment. Beautiful day. Lovely lakes views. Very peaceful.
Beautiful park to hang out in, play soccer,  or just swing on the swings. The waterfront view is breathtaking, especially at sunset. Stop on by and enjoy the view and amenities.

name: Brittingham Park
address: 829 W Washington Ave, Madison, WI 53715, USA
reviews: Great park for all ages. Multiple playgrounds for little ones. Nice shelter house for gatherings. Community garden and bike trail. Fishing must be good because there are people fishing whether it's rain, snow, shine, summer, or winter. Close to everything. Large parking lot. Multiple parking lots and recreation areas including a basketball court. Canoe, kayak, and paddle board rentals available in season. Highly recommended.

I loved this place! Huge lawns to play on, a kids playing area, a path for biking, barbecues, and easily accessible fishing areas. You name it, and you have it. Beautiful view of lake monona. Easily accessible by bus (around 3 minutes walk from the closest stop)
Lots of death fish 🤔, stinks by the Lakeshore.
Beautiful atmosphere. Very nice park and lots of ducks!
Excellent park. I walk my dog here every day

name: Lake Kegonsa State Park
address: 2405 Door Creek Rd, Stoughton, WI 53589, USA
reviews: Awesome campground. Great location. Lots of playgrounds! Tons of privacy in each spot. Beautiful views, lots of running trails with absolutely stunning landscapes. The water was not accessible though due to a thick green algae that signs warned against swimming- only reason for four stars. Coming back next weekend!

Had a great time here. Campsites are spaced well and there's brush between them to keep some privacy. There are areas where dogs are not permitted, but they also have an area just for dogs to compensate. Very pretty views. Nice staff. Will be returning!
We enjoyed walking and sitting on the nice floating  benches in the lake!

Spend one weekend here every year.  Generally without issue, however, there are wardens, federal, not rangers policing. The 1st noght which was a Thursday, we felt a bit threatened when we were asked to turn our music down.  Granted it was 1045 but we were aware of quiet time and only had one neighbor within 2 campsites. He told us flat out that we quote better not make him come back unquote. I don't understand the hostility oh, we were polite and turn the music off not down. We still had 15 minutes and we were not ridiculously loud. This was kind of a hindrance but we will return to this park because of the amenities and the Rangers that are there. They've always treated us fairly and been very nice.

We were going to theater in Janesville… And didn’t want to make the drive home. So we grab the campsite and plan to just drop camp in our van after the show… The sites are reasonable but there was some construction going on…It didn’t matter since our stay was so short… We did take a short hike before we left… The trails are nice in the park seemed alive with people.   I wouldn’t say it’s a Destination Park, but it surely met our need for a stay over and was nice and well-kept.

name: Cambridge Winery - Madison Tasting Room
address: 1001 S Whitney Way, Madison, WI 53711, USA
reviews: The wine here is great and local. The employees are knowledgeable and passionate and I learned a lot about the wine I was drinking! I highly recommend this place for a nice relaxing drink on a cold or rainy day.
Fun and knowledgeable staff. Fantastic wine tasting!

Should be 10 stars. Brought a friend of mine who "doesn't care for wine." Changed his mind about wine! Billy Peregrine is not only extremely knowledgeable, but an absolute delight. They pair food perfectly with wine if you're looking for dinner as well. Highly recommend for affordable yet fancy outings with friends. Left with 2 bottles we didn't even plan on getting it was that worth it.

We go at least once a month for the monthly tasting flights. Nice mixture of sweet and dry, light bodied and full bodied, reds and whites. Some unique, locally grown grape varieties as well as grapes sourced from New York and Central California. Enjoyable, quiet, and cozy atmosphere with friendly staff.
The two hosts that assisted us were absolutely lovely and excellent, and had a great synergy with one another

name: Physics Museum
address: 1150 University Ave, Madison, WI 53706, USA
reviews: Great free hands on physics museum.
Nice place explaining physics using showing it in action.
Interactive museum with decent exibits, a little tricky to locate. Yes it is inside a campus building

A disappointment. The college had constructed many interactive devices to illustrate physics principles but they were poorly maintained, not well enough explained, and no docents around. Looks like no one in authority was paying any attention too the place.
ALL the exhibits are for real experiments, and nearly all of them are working, and they work exactly the same as they do in Europe, and as far as I know, everywhere in the entire universe. PLASMA.

name: Badger Prairie County Park
address: 4654 Maple Grove Dr, Verona, WI 53593, USA
reviews: There are a lot of trails through Badger Prairie to enjoy, with good connectivity to other trails throughout the area. It is right in the city of Verona and you'll never completely get away from road noise, which is a drawback for me. Plenty of space where it never feels crowded, nice prairies and beautiful sunsets to be had here.

Great dog park. Very large, completely fenced-in area that the dogs can run around in off leash. There are garbage cans in 3 different places and a very small agility course in the summer. You do need to register your dog with the city and pay an entrance fee. It's something like $5/visit or $20/year (exact amounts are probably different but you get the idea). 

I highly recommend this place.

This is a pretty nice park. There are actually 2 areas, one for small dogs and one foe big, but nobody uses the small dog area. The big dog area is HUGE and the doggos can really run free. My two criticisms are that there is no water for the dogs here so you have to bring your own, and I really wish they would have the walking paths because the gravel just turns to mud when it rains.
Great, large park. Good double gate entrances. Bags provided. Great crowd of regulars.
Very nice. There is a super model duck here that will pose like crazy for anyone. But you gotta find her. Very nice park. Bathrooms could be cleaned and renovated but everything else is on point

name: Token Creek County Park
address: 6200 Williamsburg Way, DeForest, WI 53532, USA
reviews: Big beautiful dog park! Wonderful trails throughout the whole park! Also has frisbee golf! Just a lovely place to be!

Beautiful Little campground Nestle in the woods little campsites. Unfortunately there are very few campsites and a mosquito population is 1 million to 1 1 million mosquitoes to one human. Other than that quiet great facilities beautiful place

Fun county Park camping. We're able to secure a secluded camping spot the day we wanted to camp without reserving ahead of time. 
As a caution, we did find quite a few ticks here.

Beautiful park, out of the way from Madison, but still close enough for an easy drive. Would highly recommend going when it's warmer though. No fault of the park, just snow buildup is a problem in most of Wisconsin anyway.

There are many regulars here - really great dogs & owners- that make this park great.  

There is a large enclosed area specifically for puppies and small breeds.  This area has some fun agility features, like a tunnel, jumps, a tire.

There are some trees, but the is mostly a wide open area.  Plenty of picnic tables and benches throughout the vast property. 

The reason for 4 stars instead of 5 is how hectic it can be on Saturdays, lots of large breeds and many times I've had to offer the use of my leash to owners to prompt them to get better control of their aggressive doggo.  

In all, my 2nd favorite Madison dog park.

name: Mendota County Park
address: 5133 Co Hwy M, Middleton, WI 53562, USA
reviews: Lovely park, where you can sit on a bench by the lake and look at the water (among other things to do).  Here you don't have to pay eleven dollars to look at the lake, as you do at the nearby state park.  Beautiful and fairly peaceful, with camping and full facilities.

Awesome park with lots of amenities. Large kid's playground, multiple shelter areas, a boat landing/dock, a small swimming area, lots of tables/benches, and a large portion of the park set up for campers/RV's. Definitely a busy park with plenty of parking on site. Check out the park sign, as it gives some of the parks history and references to effigy mounds.
Always a Beautiful location to stop at look at beautiful lake mendota.
The lake by itself has such beautiful views. I could sit there all day if I didn't have to work. Lol.
It very hot here so we gone down by the lake and cool off it's very pretty  here to watch people  on the lake

name: Fisher King Winery
address: 1105 Laser St, Verona, WI 53593, USA
reviews: Loved the Marquette wine and the sconnie board was awesome and affordable. Worth checking out this cute Verona winery!

My favorite wine place in Verona so far. They moved from Mt. Horeb to here and I like their new location more. There is more space overall and the different parts each feel cozier. I think they made a pretty good port and like most of their other wines as well. They have a mix of local and non local grapes used in their wines, sell chocolates and some charcuterie at the bar. They also host a variety of events like live music and paint nights which are nice. Overall a good ambiance with friendly staff.

Cute little place, reminded me more of a wine bar than a winery and the wine wasn’t my favorite and seemed a bit overpriced. They offer small snacks and charcuterie plates also that are fun and delicious, but again on the pricey side. The service was just okay and nothing to really write about. I wouldn’t go out of my way to visit but it might be fun for a one time stop while in the area.
I like the wines pretty well, and it's fun to do tastings here. The bottles are kind of pricey though.
Wine was pretty good.   The music was WAY too long. Could not carry on a conversation.   If I wanted loud music I'd go to a bar.

name: Warner Park Beach
address: 1101 Woodward Dr, Madison, WI 53704, USA
reviews: Beautiful beach.. There is a lot of seaweed right now though.
Nice place to catch sunsets.  Sometimes there are some not so desirable hanging around but hey, it's a city park with a great view I can't blame them for wanting to be there too

Beach is really rocky, but there is an area with a life guard on duty. Place to launch motor craft if you posses it, also areas for people to deploy personal watercraft like kayak. Best part is the wide open park area with lots of shade and plenty of benches and  tables for picnicking. Can be kind of sketchy later at night especially in the summer time. Also a dog park/overflow parking lot right around the corner which is also a nice place to take your doggo.
A nice place to go by the lake and just watch the fishermen and the ducks.
Quite, pretty, a boat launch, some parking

name: Edna Taylor Conservation Park
address: 802 Femrite Dr, Madison, WI 53716, USA
reviews: It is a small marsh with grassy areas full of trees and hidden paths. I enjoyed a morning walk around there. Its beautiful!
Loved walking in the park
Always a peaceful place to visit and to see great wildlife !
Wonderful place for birds and other wildlife

Hidden east side Marvel.  This was once an ancient village of Mound Builders 1000-1500 years ago, complete with it's own mini Isthmus, walking trails leading to 300 foot long mounds atop a terminal drumlin that rises 150 foot above freshwater spring fed ponds.

name: Alumni Park at UW-Madison
address: 724 Langdon St, Madison, WI 53706, USA
reviews: Great access to Lake Mendota. Outstanding for people watching.

A must see in Madison!  Go Twice, once during the day and then again at night.  It is two different experiences for sure.  The night lighting is cool but you don't get to see everything if you go at night as some exhibits are only visible during the day.
It's a great place for sharing with friends or by yourself,  great landscape 😎😍
I love being in this place as it's a source of happiness to me. Most people do a great job by keeping it clean
Very nice place, but it was wet and cold outside.

name: City of Madison Parks
address: 210 Martin Luther King Jr Blvd, Madison, WI 53703, USA
reviews:
Madison is fortunate, indeed, to have the array of natural areas we can and may enjoy within the city, and on its outskirts.  For instance, at Warner Park on the north side of town, I've seen wild turkeys, pelicans, swans, cranes, red tail hawks, great blue herons, painted turtles, frogs, toads, tree swallows, turkey vultures, belted kingfisher, grey catbirds, sharp-shinned hawks, red-bellied woodpeckers, pileated woodpeckers, American goldfinches, Cooper's hawks, scarlet tanagers, indigo buntings, osprey, ruby-throated hummingbirds, foxes, white-tailed deer, and the all-too-common mallard ducks and Canadian geese.  The flora are also vast, and there's a significant stand of black walnut trees in one area of this large city park.  It also offers a large field that is fenced, so your licensed day may run off leash - please pick up after it!

I would give five stars were it not for the fact that I called today with a question, and waited for the 9th ring before my call was answered with "City of Madison Parks Department, can you hold?"  First off, it is for some obscure reason, a division, not a department.  Second off, clearly there is insufficient staff to answer the phone.  Third, I waited on hold for ten minutes before I gave up.  TIME IS MONEY.  My time is worth something to me, but further, I pay real money to charge my phone, and for every minute I'm on a connected telephone call, and that money was burnt in a fire when nothing is accomplished during the call.  In modern times where everybody has a mobile phone, government and business need to stop conducting business like people are still all using landlines where you can talk as many hours as you want each month, and the bill is always the same.
Keep up the good work
Nice places 🙌
Good

name: Henry Vilas Zoo
address: 702 S Randall Ave, Madison, WI 53715, USA
reviews:
Free zoo! Just got some nice updates. 

This listing needs a better picture. Vet surgery tables? Really? Yet Vilas park nearby gets a picture of a giraffe, which it would be virtually impossible to see from the park. Fix please
The animals look so sad. This zoo looks run down, and the poor animals hardly have any space to move around. I’m surprised by all the five stars... these animals need a happier life.

This is one of the better free zoo's that I have been to. Always enjoy it.  Went recently to check their Christmas lights.  Very very cool. I highly recommend visiting this zoo any time of year.  Thank you to everyone that makes this zoo possible and remain free to the public

This is a great zoo and it has free admission. Since the first time I've been here, and I  have been countless times, they have added a primate exhibit, an aviary, a children's area, and upgraded the polar exhibit. They have plans  to continue their upateds into the future. As I understand it, the land was bequeathed to the zoo with the stipulation that it be free of admission. I also heard that they have had greater than average success breeding lions. They have 4 adults right now.

Wonderful free zoo.  I take my kids here about 1-2 times a year.  It's perfect for younger kids who can't handle an all day excursion at a bigger zoo.  The last few times we went, we either brought a picnic lunch and ate at the park adjacent to the zoo or we purchased food at the park's grill and ate at one of the picnic tables inside the zoo.  They also have an awesome playground for kids too.

name: UW-Madison Lakeshore Nature Preserve
address: 2000 University Bay Dr, Madison, WI 53705, USA
