reviews: Great walking and jogging paths with lots of fire pits and picnic spaces. Beautiful wildflower fields and lake views. Great place to see a sunset. Paid parking during work hours. About 1.9 miles round trip unless you take one of spurs.

Well maintained trail system through the woods. Even after a rainfall, the trails were in good condition. Trails are on a hill going to and from the lake shore of Lake Mendota. Stairs and bridges are built to make the climbs safer.
Definitely make it out to the point for nice views back towards the plaza.
It stretches from the Eagle Heights Nature Area to Picnic Point on the University of Wisconsin campus in Madison. A real jewel!
We love this place! It can get pretty packed with outdoor enthusiasts, but that is never a reason to feel deterred from going for a morning/evening walk, jog, run.  Very well marked and clean paths.

name: Nook
address: 2138 Atwood Ave, Madison, WI 53704, USA
reviews: Most excellent experience. This was our first time at Nook and the food was absolutely incredible. Each course was impeccably executed, both visually and by taste. Chef Noah was an absolute joy. Highly recommend this gem of a restaurant, Madison is so fortunate to have the Nook!

We like to cook, we like to eat, we like the company of others.  We like camaraderie of others and a bit of adventure and whimsy in our lives.  All of this was met at Nook.  The chef(s) had stories behind the dishes so instead of just eating, you understood the how it was made and the why.  The serving platters were different every course and were unique.  The long table allowed us to make new friends and enjoy new conversations.  The pairings were fun and allowed us to try things we usually would not have.  I think if you're looking for an intimate and creative way to dine and like great food and a bit of adventure - this is a MUST in Madison!

I’ve never been anywhere like this before and I loved it! The atmosphere is cozy and fun, the service is super friendly and attentive, and Chef Noah is amazing. The food was plated beautifully and tasted equally as delicious. Chef Noah took the time to describe every dish in entertaining detail. I can’t wait to go back!
Phenomenal time. Got full with 4 courses to go.
Absolutely phenomenal. Excellent food, friendly and helpful staff, beautiful space. Great music and just an all-around welcoming experience. I can't wait for our next visit.

name: Graft
address: 18 N Carroll St, Madison, WI 53703, USA
reviews: I highly recommend dinner at Graft!  Super delicious all around.  The carrot salad was spot on.  You especially have to try the smashed potatoes. They are a real treat!.  The Pork Loin and Short Rib were both very savory and flavorful. You have to get the Pot de creme for dessert. Everything was wonderful from  the first bite of the carrot salad to the last bite of dessert.  All the staff were very friendly and provided excellent service as well.

Stopped into Graft on a Friday evening about 5pm for an early dinner and drink and was not disappointed. Cozy atmosphere at the bar with a nice view of the capital building. Staff was informative and friendly. We shared a couple of small plates and they were all delish. Especially liked the broken Caesar salad dressing on asparagus - yum.
This place made the most delicious bite I've ever put in my mouth, in my 60+ years. Grilled asparagus in a deconstructed Caesar salad. Incredible!! But, really, everything we had was perfect.

My second visit to Graft was another very good experience.  My favorite BLT was no longer on the menu but that was okay since it keeps the menu fresh.  The prawns are awesome with a touch of roasted coconut and sweet potato puree.  New was the asparagus 'caesar salad' style.  A touch too much oil for me but still good, just my personal taste.
The restaurant has an amazing atmosphere, with a very elegant design. The food was outstanding and full of flavor.

name: Graze
address: 1 S Pinckney St #107, Madison, WI 53703, USA
reviews: Most everything is great about this place. Great food, great service, and great atmosphere. It's very vegetarian and 'alt-diet' friendly and staff are accommodating and responsive. My ONE gripe is that their cocktails are not great. They need a legit bartender/manager running the show back there and they need quality control. Beer and wine are fine but the cocktails need some love, guys. Please improve your pours and let's get back to 5 stars.

Graze, is a super cozy place especially for a late lunch. It can get very busy during the lunch hour. A friend and I met shortly after 12:30pm and it was very packed until around 1:10pm. My friend and I basically ordered the same lunch menu, "Harvest salad". To me, the wait time was absolutely prolonged given what we ordered - salad. It was about a 15 minute wait time. My friend enjoyed a glass of wine, while I had a hot tea. So, not much adventure regarding this lunch. But it was my first time and I thoroughly enjoyed my meal. The only thing I might say was that if you love blue cheese, make sure you order extra blue cheese on the side. It seems they really ration the portion in the salad. I may not have tasted the blue cheese if I had not ordered extras. For those who are okay with a slight taste of blue cheese, this is a great salad to have it with. Everything in the salad also seemed very fresh and well put together. I hope you enjoy it at least as much as I did or even more.

This was my first time to Madison & I went with a coworker. I ordered the Banh Mi (without the baguette) & a side of cheese curds (because it's Wisconsin after all). I enjoyed ever bit of this fresh meal. Our server was Martha & she was extremely professional, personable and attentive. I will absolutely go back the next time I'm in town.
Amazing food! Everything was absolutely delicious. Fresh vibrant flavors. Atmosphere was romantic and cozy. Have been telling everyone I know about this place!

Came here for lunch & loved everything about this place. Starting off with the location, which is right in front of the capitol with amazing views. The service was tremendous & my food as well. I had an order of the pork steamed buns & wow was it packed with flavor. Loved how crispy the pork was on the outside & juicy in the inside. Definitely order this as a starter if you come here.

name: Heritage Tavern
address: 131 E Mifflin St, Madison, WI 53703, USA
reviews: The best taste I have ever had in Madison. Elegant and flavorful. Waiters are super friendly and helpful!

Best restaurant in Madison! The chefs are creative with nightly specials and the menu changes with the seasons because their ingredients come from local farms. The quality of the food is top notch & the staff is very knowledgeable and welcoming. I wish I could eat here every night.

Amazing restaurant! The atmosphere was inviting and quiet and the food was DELICIOUS! Our server was very knowledgeable and helped us with our questions (we were a big group). The cheese board is a must when you come here. And get the full board, you don't want to miss any of the options. The food portions for the big plates were pretty big! No one regretted any of their choices. The dessert were phenomenal but the portions were tiny.
Overall, a place that I'd recommend and definitely come back to

The best! Eat here. 

The best food, cocktails, everything! The ham sandwich for brunch is amazing. Also, anything with eggs. Their specialty is pork, so I would get anything that contains. Additionally, this restaurant has some truly gifted staff. If you do decide to dine here, I would suggest asking them based on what the restaurant has at that time. They are so knowledgeable and I would trust their recommendations over my choice! 

Also, thank you to their kind staff for giving us champagne when my fiance and I got engaged! It was such a nice touch for our evening!
Food was amazing. Service was great.  The deviled eggs were the best I have ever had and both meals were memorable.  We will definitely be back.

name: A Pig In A Fur Coat
address: 940 Williamson St, Madison, WI 53703, USA
reviews:
Heard a lot of great things about Pig in a Fur Coat before I went, and I was not disappointed! First off, definitely get the duck fat fries. Repeating once more for the folks in the back: DEFINITELY GET THE DUCK FAT FRIES. 

Other than that, the place is a shareable plate/tapas restaurant, so order a lot and share everything! I went with my significant other, and we got the octopus and pork belly for small plates and the rabbit for our large plate. Everything was perfectly cooked, perfectly seasoned, and packed with flavor. 

Overall we got five dishes to share (3 plates, 1 duck fat fries, 1 dessert) and it was the perfect amount of food for two people. Be cautioned though, plus two drinks easily put us over $100 for the meal, but the food is definitely worth the price.

Very happy to stumble upon this place. I had dinner at the bar. Bartender helped pair a good red wine with me food. I really don't know what to say, just look at those pictures and go try this place for yourself. It was very good. The restaurant is cozy and good for a quiet dinner with good company. Loved it.

We arrived when it opened so it was nice and quiet compared to other reviews. Service was fairly quick. We ordered 2 apps and large plates. I have to say it was a lot of food. The pork chop and wagyu ribeye did not disappoint at all. Couldn't finish them so we packed them to go. Overall, it's worth checking out if you don't mind spending a bit more.

People always say nothing is perfect. If there is one, it must be there. This little restaurant is the best I have ever visited in the USA. Although there are many Michelin-starred restaurant in the US, but this is what I feel should called a real restaurant. The food are just perfect, waitresses and waiters are super friendly, the atmosphere is elegant and warm, people all enjoying their food. Can’t wait to come here again!

Booked a month in advance by telephone. We arrived on time (7pm) and a lady with little interest told us there was a considerable wait. I though I must have misheard her as that could only mean they had overbooked - no restaurant has a considerable wait at 7pm unless they have allowed too many people to dine from 6pm. 

So we sat at the bar and we waited and we waited. I caught the lady’s eye a few times but she did not come over to provide any update. She even walked past me. 

I was ready to walk out but my wife said she would ask for an update. She waited patiently in the restaurant and the same lady walked past another few times without acknowledging her. My wife finally said ‘excuse me’ and asked for an update. This was after 15 minutes of waiting. She said she would go and find out - so obviously wasn’t doing anything about it up to then. 

She returned to say there would be another 10-15 wait. We all know that means 25-30 minutes. When I said that was not OK she offered us a drink and appetizer but too little too late. A restaurant experience does not involve being left in a corner for 15 minutes u til you complain and only then do you offer something to appease a disgruntled customer. 

I said we would be leaving and she simply walked off.  No apology.  

No longer will we be eating at Pig in a Fur Coat nor buying our meats from Alimentari.  I though USA service was the best in the world. Not at this establishment.

name: L'Etoile
address: 1 S Pinckney St #107, Madison, WI 53703, USA
reviews: Second time visiting here and doing the chef tasting menu both times. This time they included a surprise course about half way through which was an amazing pretzel bun with carmelized shallot and onion ash butter. The staff are very attentive and friendly. It is pretty pricey but definitely worth it. Be warned, each dish seems small but adds up to a ton of food. I was stuffed when I left.

I won't beat around the bush. L'Etoile is one of the two best restaurants in Wisconsin, and this is a state that abounds in good food. Come to L'Etoile for a special experience where you be welcomed as an old friend, enjoy exquisitely beautiful ambience, and be treated to creative and original cuisine. Oh yah, and the wine list is enormous and frankly astounding. L'Etoile is Perfection with a Heart and Soul.

We had the Family Meal during the current pandemic. Everything included in the meal was fantastic - there is no skimping on quality or quantity, The value was perfect, I would highly recommend this option for restaurant quality "take-out" food.

27 Sep 2019 - Former Chef de Cuisine Itaru Nagano has moved on, but L'Etoile delivered another spectacular dinner tonight, with the octopus a special standout!  Monkfish also was great, and I was very pleased to see a cheese tray that let me select which I wanted after my meal.  Keep up the great work!
- - - - - - - - -
17 July 2019 -

L'Etoile NEVER fails to deliver magnificence in dining.

Spurred on by the online menu, which featured veal sweetbreads and other delicacies I found too irresistible to put off enjoying, I determined to have another splendid meal at L'Etoile.  I wasn't disappointed!

Dinner began with a special treat from the kitchen when Chef Itaru sent me a gift of a delicious course featuring goat cheese, something which I delight in.  The photo is among those I'm posting to show the delights of tonight's meal.  I had hoped for, and wanted, a bottle of Arneis di Roero, an unusual white Denominazione di Origine Controllata e Garantita (DOCG) wine from the Piemonte in the northwest of Italy.  Alas, L'Etoile could not offer me that, and after some discussion with my waiter, I agreed to try an unfamiliar grape, in a "Vermentino" varietal from the region of Liguria, in the northwest of Italy, where the city of Genoa is found.  It proved to be an amazing wine, and I'm thankful to Frank for his recommendation!  I was well-cared for by Frank and his assistant, Thomas, along with other waitstaff who lent a hand to ensure my dinner was up to the standards of the typical marvelous L'Etoile dinner.

My special meal began with the above-mentioned and unexpected treat from the chef, and thereafter, continued with my plans, with the exception of the dessert, which I had intended should be recommended from the "normal" desserts on the menu, but was instead an item from the tasting menu which had QUITE got me attention as an entrée item.

SWEETBREADS
Chicharrón, gorgeous green fava beans, queso fresco
These nuggets of delicious veal thymus were so amazing I felt compelled to ask for a special wine to accompany them, and ended up with a glass of Bual Madeira, most of which I enjoyed with the sweetbreads, but a small portion of which I saved for further on in the menu . . . 

SCALLOPS
Eggplant purée was amazingly delicious!, duck confit demanded a bit of the Madeira, blueberry - this was marvelous!  It reminded me of the perfection of toasted/toasted marshmallows I used to strive to make for a neighbor lady who I quite liked as a boy, for the spectacular lasagna she made and shared with us as children.

AU BON CANARD FOIE GRAS
Burnt Strawberry 
While there was not a lot of duck liver here, and I knew that in advance, it was chosen to be my dessert instead of the conventional options from the menu.  It was a marvelous choice!  While the custom selected wine for this course was a lesser version of the first grown Sauternes, the remnants of my Madeira, and the Italian white wine also went nicely with it, and I ended my meal in heaven.

THANK YOU EVERYONE AT L'ETOILE FOR CONTINUING TO LIVE UP TO THE EXPECTATIONS DINERS LIKE ME HAVE COME TO HAVE FOR DROPPING IN UNEXPECTEDLY FOR A SPECIAL MEAL!

A simply stunning New Year's Eve prix fixe dinner featuring the incomparable Tory Miller, Elizabeth Dahl, and sommelier Michael Kwas, and the incredible waitstaff, like our server Caitlyn.  Every bite and every dollar is worth it.

name: Cento
address: 122 W Mifflin St, Madison, WI 53703, USA
reviews:
We were fortunate to have planned an early dinner the night we ate at Cento. Walking in with no reservation at 5pm on a Saturday, we snagged a bar table in the corner and then watched the whole restaurant fill up within minutes.

As an appetizer, we ordered wine-poached beets, a bright, fresh and flavorful dish that came out quickly from the kitchen. I was happy we had the starter because there was then quite a wait for our mains. I ordered a margherita pizza and my husband had the tagliatelle pasta. When we finally had our meals, both dishes were tasty, though the pasta was a bit salty and I would have preferred a crispier crust on my pizza.

Overall, we enjoyed our experience. Beyond what we ordered the menu featured lots of creative twists on familiar Italian dishes. The food presentation was lovely and our service was great. If we hadn’t had to wait as long for our main course, we probably would have ordered dessert too, but it had gotten pretty late and we didn’t want to stay. If we’re ever in the area again, I’d definitely go back, just on a less busy evening.

I was very impressed by the food and the price for that tasty food! But don't too many people😅. They have a wonderful building for the restaurant! Sunday brunch is awesome! Good drinks. The service is quick and a friendly staff! Maybe for some older folks, the stairs to restroom may be an issue. A new favorite place to eat!

One of my absolute favorite restaurants in Madison! Their boozy brunch is such a good deal, the happy hour is good, and their pasta is amazing! Such a beautiful space with good service. I love that they allow you to reserve a table online as well. Definitely check it out!

Tucked between the Overture and State, Cento is a classy bit of dining well situated. We ate in the back room, a quieter added space that still held its own ambience. Food, drinks, and service were on point. Couldn’t have asked for a more reasonable bit of upscale Italian this close to the Capitol.
Went here for my 21st birthday and loved it. Waitstaff was so helpful with the menu and dissecting what to eat. Their recommendations were amazing and the experience was awesome!

name: Tornado Steak House
address: 116 S Hamilton St, Madison, WI 53703, USA
reviews: My husband and I had our first experience at Tornado this past weekend and we were not disappointed! The food was amazing and the staff was superb, we were both thoroughly impressed. Our water glasses were never empty and our dishes were cleared immediately. It is a little pricey, but if you look at their website prior to going, there will be no surprises with pricing. We had a wonderful time and cannot wait until our next visit!

This is a very great experience overall. The seafood bisque was great and had lumps of crab meat. I ordered the 8 oz filet and it was spectacular. It was cooked perfectly and very tender. The taste was great as well with minimal seasoning. Overall, I enjoyed my experience.

The quintessential steakhouse enveloped in a dreamy, woodsy, supper club atmosphere, bathed in low red light. 

So, that’s why the photo of my amazing flank steak looks meh. 

If you love supper clubs and darkened interiors with fabulous eats and drink choices, make a night of it and hit the Tornado.
Excellent food!! King crab was huge and tasty! Service was top notch

I was in Madison at the home office for American Family Insurance and we "stumbled upon" this cool steak house.  Our food was great!!  I would go back for sure.  The shrimp cocktail was excellent too.

name: RED
address: 316 W Washington Ave #100, Madison, WI 53703, USA
reviews: I have always been a fan and gave the 5-star rating years ago but today deserves a full review and if I could give another five stars, I would. I had lunch today with a CEO from Japan for a business meeting. The staff was extraordinary. The service was impeccable. The food was stunning. I am proud this restaurant is in Madison... it makes Madison a better place.

World class offerings... So delicious! I highly recommend the spicy Godzilla shrimp roll, and the brussel sprouts, which were fantastic! Make reservations,  this place is very popular! The food was so much better than any other sushi restaurant that I have ever tried... It is pricey, but so very worth every penny.

This sushi bar is an absolute must if you're looking for a classy atmosphere and some top quality sushi or sashimi.  Great for small groups or large, the food is great and the prices are pretty on point for the service and the quality of food.  The only thing I would recommend is that if you can, try to get a reservation made.  Even when I go here as a party of two there's usually a wait even for a seat at the bar.

This place is amazing! The food is delicious and the service is superb! The food is a bit pricey for most items. So plan accordingly if you go here. The staff is knowledgeable on all items and can answer any question you might have if you are a first time sushi eater. My aunt and I ordered a mix of items and then shared what we ordered with each other. There is loud house music, so if you dont like club music, you might not like their atmosphere. You are able to take home any sushi you do not eat. They pack it up in a nice container. Overall, great experience, food tastes delicious, and I will definitely be back!

Excellent customer service, high-quality sushi, wonderful atmosphere - what more can you ask for? 

Delicious every time and the server made great suggestions. We never had to wait for anything to be refilled. All around great experience!

name: Dotty Dumpling's Dowry
address: 317 N Frances St, Madison, WI 53703, USA
reviews: I love Dotty’s!  Atmosphere is so cute- waiters wear retro-like clothes, and they play old school music!  Food was amazing!! And really reasonably priced!  Built-your-own burger for $6.99, add fries for like 2 more bucks.  The salad was phenomenal!  Great, not-too-greasy cheese curds!! Wish I had discovered this gem sooner!

Great place to go before games at the Kohl Center. We frequently stop here before hockey games and its always a good time. Good food and a good selection of beer. Its a bit small so it can get crowded quick. If you're stopping in before a badger game, I recommend arriving early.

Uniquely creative burgers in a laid back, ambient setting.  Bring your friends, bring your SO, bring your parents, bring ANYONE from out of town (unless they're vegan), and enjoy the food and drinks here.  The atmosphere is enough to keep you there for longer than necessary, and the rest will keep you coming back.  I ♡ this restaurant!

Fantastic burger in the Madison area. Check out the melting pot burger. Don't skip the garlic sauce. Great curds. Really cool atmosphere inside. Waitress was very friendly. Will definitely return when we are in the area. Highly recommended.
Great tap beer selection paired with lots of great burger options. Add in old movies(or local sports) on TV and you've got a great bar. The dining area is nice too if that's more your scene.

name: Lombardino's Restaurant
address: 2500 University Ave, Madison, WI 53705, USA
reviews: Exceeded expectations. Scrumptious, savory, mouthwatering delights! Well trained professional staff. Intimate atmosphere. Looking forward to returning soon.

I am new to Madison and this is already one of my favorite restaurants. The truffle mushroom pizza and Caesar salad is awesome! I’ve been here twice now with the hope of trying something new because everything on their menu looks enticing... but that Caesar salad and pizza call my name every time :) The bartenders and staff are very friendly and I feel like there is a very family-oriented and welcome home vibe from all patrons.
Really cozy interior with great food. The salad was had unique flavors and was amazing!

WOW, amazing meal tonight!
Started with the house salad and Pizza carbonara,  then the short ribs.
One of the most delicious meals we've had in a long time.

I go to Lombardinos at least once a year as it's my brother's favorite restaurant (his birthday dinner) in Madison. He loves the spaghetti bolognese, and so do I. Haven't had a bad thing on the menu: duck breast, pork chop, beef, fantastic pasta dishes. Really great food, if it's your first time, I recommend one of the pastas. Honestly, my favorite dish is probably the pork chop though! So delicious with the olive oil and escarole. This place is a Madison classic that my family loves to eat at.

name: Alchemy
address: 1980 Atwood Ave, Madison, WI 53704, USA
reviews:
Outstanding food! The small batch bread was a delicious start to a thoroughly satisfying meal.

The stuffed grilled cheese was fantastic and the burger was one of the best I've had in a while. Service was on the ball, friendly, and attentive.

Definitely a strong recommendation should you find yourself in the neighborhood.
My go to when I want to go out, but can't make up my mind. Drinks are fantastic. Food is good (fries are amazing). Sometimes really busy, but most of the time we get seated no problem.

Very good food and service. Nice beer selection. Wonderful atmosphere for eating dinner or hanging out in the bar. Came here on a suggestion of places to stop at while driving through the area. Love the food and friendly staff. Must go and try for yourself.

If you want some of the best food in Madison, do not hesitate on Alchemy. Small cozy space with a very beautiful bar and seating is creative. The drinks menu is fantastic and great rotating craft beer taps and an even better rotating food menu that NEVER disappoints. Just go here and enjoy the experience!

This place could not be any better. I'd like to come in and sit at their bar but I can't resist their food. Their menu is quaint yet diverse. The music is joyous. The people are kind and efficient. Do yourself a favor and GO HERE. Then, best of luck when this is the only restaurant you want to go to.

name: Tempest Oyster Bar
address: 120 E Wilson St, Madison, WI 53703, USA
reviews: Romantic vibe. Nicely decorated. You can check in your coats. We were seated fairly fast for a group of 15. If you're not a seafood person I don't recommend you to eat here. Drinks were good. I recommend the house cocktails, yum! Good selection of drinks.  Steak  was ok, not much seasoning but the potato scallops were delicious. Pork chops were good too. A friend order the lamb chop and said it was undercooked. Also, their oysters had a funky smell. It didn't taste like it was fresh. Kinda sad when it's what they were known for-good oysters?? Overall,  I had a good time.

Holy cow does this place have ambiance. The nautical theme is intense and adorable. But don't let some of the kitschy pieces fool you - there's no joking around when it comes to the food. Incredible steak and seafood cooked perfectly. My only complaint is that the carrot cake was a bit dry and could have used a little more sugar and spice. Everything else was beyond perfect.

We celebrated my husband’s 60th birthday at Tempest Oyster Bar and everything was beyond perfect. The food, from appetizers through dinner, was amazing and the customer service was that and more. A big thank you to the entire staff, especially Eric, for doing so much to make the experience for our group of twelve so great. Who says you have to go to the coasts or down south for great seafood? We’ve eaten in many coastal restaurants and Tempest ranks with the best of them. We will be back!!!
Excellent service! Had the red snapper and the server gave me pointers on how to eat it. Much appreciated! Tasty drinks, wish they were a bit stronger. Overall a great date night.

We had a table for 5 walking in at 1015pm. We were seated quickly. Server took about 5 minutes to come to the table and get drink orders. After we got drinks the server took our food orders. 20 minutes later the server came back and said almost half of what we ordered was not available while simultaneously serving one dish of what we had ordered. We modified our order to fit the available dishes and waited. The rest of our came at 1130pm. We watched smaller tables place their orders and get served before any of got any decent part of our order. We were trying to take advantage of the late night menu deals and ended up being charged full price anyway. They did fix the total when that was pointed out. The food was decent. The food is the only reason I’m putting 4 stars, the service was atrocious:

name: Bonfyre American Grille
address: 2601 W Beltline Hwy, Madison, WI 53713, USA
reviews: Good not great. To get their best steaks, it's either $51 or $60 bucks. At that price you can get better steaks elsewhere. Menu is quirky, but if you like obnoxiously Bloody Mary's, worth checking out for brunch once. To make this place a value, sign up for their birthday club, you'll get $20 toward an entree. Their Irish Margaritas are good and the wood grill makes it cozy.

A high end place to grab bite to eat for lunch or dinner, located just off the beltline.

A wide selection of dishes to choose from.  Bonfyre offers salads, sandwiches, stakes, and bowls.  There are vegetarian options along with gluten free as well.  The veggie black bean burger is good. For a side the roasted red potatoes I would recommend.

Nice open bar to sit at while you wait for your table.  Good beer and cocktail selection.  Service is very good, friendly, and attentive.  Extra parking in the ramp is available in the back if you can't find a spot out front.  It can get a bit loud when it is busy so it can be hard to hold a conversation.

The cheesecake mousse dessert is amazing. Try it you won't be disappointed.
Our first visit, and it was for Fathers Day. From the Service, decor, the entrees, and dessert. It was amazing. The best-grilled shrimp I think I've ever had.
Great meal. Excellent food. Atmosphere was a perfect break for us, having a "Parents Night Out" dinner. Casual yet polished. Recommended :-)

Rave review! I ate here yesterday and the food was EXCELLENT. It's funny, this place has always been good but the last few months, I feel like they stepped their game up somehow. The food is better than ever. If you're in the Madison area, Bonfyre is a must. 10/10.

name: Osteria Papavero
address: 128 E Wilson St, Madison, WI 53703, USA
reviews: It’s a cute place and their service is wonderful and friendly. Something I didn’t appreciate was when my siblings ordered their clam with rocket fish, they didn’t tell them they had ran out of rocket fish and gave us cod instead. We had found out after our dinner. Otherwise it’s a great restaurant.

Very good Italian food, and great service too. The gazpacho was excellent, and the lasagna all Bolognese was perfect. Dessert and wine were great as well.

Definitely a great place to go for lunch in Madison!
I love going to papavero for lunch. The atmosphere is more relaxed and parking is convenient.

I went here during the restaurant week. The price was $25 and it included an appetizer (fried seafood), a main course (halibut), and a dessert (cake). The appetizer was great in quality and taste. The halibut was much smaller than I expected and the taste was descent. The dessert was Ok. The biggest concern here was the service. The waiter never smiled to me and was frowning all the time. She never refilled my water and never said thank you. A professional waiter should not do any of these

Osteria is a great place. I hadn't been here in a few years as my travels haven't taken me to Madison as often. But when they did this was one of my go to places and it hasn't changed. I think it even got better. It is one of the great spots in Madison to eat.
It is a very small dining room so you should try and make reservations, but walk-ins are welcome and there is always the bar. The food is ever changing with a great assortment of dishes on the daily board. While your there they may even erase one of them and substitute it with another. So you know this is all made to order. I really love the appetizers also and save room for dessert.

name: Pat O'Malley's Jet Room
address: 3606 Corben Ct, Madison, WI 53704, USA
reviews: We’re new to the Madison area and wanted to go somewhere for good breakfast food on a Sunday afternoon. Found this little place on google maps and we’re SO glad we did! Food was delicious, you can really tell everything is homemade. The old school diner vibe is fun and we had THE BEST SERVICE. You can tell they get a lot of regulars because they greeted some customers by name. Our waitress was so nice and attentive. We will definitely be back!
Excellent food and very friendly staff. It was our first visit but we will definitely be going back. Try the potato pancakes - they are awesome.

Slam dunk! If you are on the fence about coming here, climb down, run inside, scoot up a chair, and dig in! The breakfast was great, the busy atmosphere was excellent, and the service was awesome. I'll be back -- bringing the fam! Cool to see all the planes outside, too.

We were in Madison for a concert and wanted to get some breakfast before heading home. It was awesome! Delicious, quality food at very reasonable prices. Cool views of the runway. Great benedicts. Would like to try more items if we're ever in town again!

Simply the BEST breakfast in the Madison area! Seven kinds of eggs Benedict on the menu .. highly recommend the crab cakes eggs Benedict and the tenderloin medallion eggs Benedict! Don't be fooled by the location .. right at the airport!

name: Bassett Street Brunch Club
address: 444 W Johnson St, Madison, WI 53716, USA
reviews: Can I just. Please never take the coconut cream pie french toast off the menu, it is so good. The place is always busy but food is always worth it. This place is a Madison staple and almost every dish off the brunch menu is amazing. They have variety for all kinds of diets whether you want just a wholesome steel cut oatmeal or a hefty chicken and waffle (or donut, won't judge if you get both).

LOUD dance club music... for breakfast? 
We literally had to yell at each other to hear what we were saying. Even the staff had to shout at each other. I don't want to hear super loud bass driven music about bump and grind with my eggs at 10am. Completely ruined the brunch experience.
The food was edible. My French toast was burnt. Not worth the wait or price.

Great breakfast!  Very modern atmosphere. We shared a delightful donut!! My husband loved his chili chorizo breakfast burrito.  My avocado toast was delicious, with the only critique being that I wish the bread was sliced thinner. The greens on the side were light and refreshing.  Monday morning with no wait time!

Overall, we enjoyed our experience. The green goddess grilled cheese and chicken & donut were big hits. The burger didn't deliver on the big flavor the menu described (some sriracha mayo helped fix that), and the salad was just fine. Good sized portions, reasonable prices, and great service.

You cannot pick a bad thing to order here, everything on their menu is delicious. The staff is (usually) friendly and the service is great. My friend lived in the building next to it my freshman year so we were able to put our name down, go back to sleep, and come down an hour later to a table. I only wish they might mix up their menu a little bit or add weekly specials.

name: La Kitchenette
address: 805 Williamson St, Madison, WI 53703, USA
reviews: Absolutely incredible service...absolutely incredible food...absolutely incredible ambience! Wonderful restaurant! 5 stars and 5 cheers all around for La Kitchenette! Stopped in for a quick lunch date and was greeted and sat ourselves in an intimate dining area. Our server Ethan was warm, informative and not over bearing. I had Biquette and tea but it was so good I only snagged a picture of dessert. I will definitely be back to enjoy their two for $45 date night on Tuesdays.

Home style French cooking. The food is outstanding, and the staff is friendly and helpful. It's on the small side, which creates a homey atmosphere, but also means you should make a reservation. Très bien!

Fantastic food and even better service, our server Ethan was incredibly attentive and helpful with making a choice on the large brunch menu. I can highly recommend the French onion soup, the Green French Toast and the garlic potatoes. For dessert we had the Brioche French Toast which was absolutely incredible. Not to forget the homemade Belgian Hot chocolate. We'll definitely be back!

We have been to la kitchenette several times before the pandemic.   Food was always good but I’m especially impressed with the daily curbside pickup specials they now offer.  Everything is delicious, very little plastic is involved and they seem to have new specials frequently.

A little gem in Madison, with a romantic and cozy ambiance. The food is outstanding as well as the service. Whatever you order make sure you get some of their persillade potatoes, they melt in your mouth! If you are there for brunch, don't forget to try the Green French Toast.

name: North and South Seafood & Smokehouse Madison
address: 6604 Mineral Point Rd, Madison, WI 53705, USA
reviews:
My family and I had a really great experience at North & South this weekend the food was fabulous the service excellent. Having never eaten there before, we were surprised to see every table filled on a late Saturday afternoon, we were promptly seated, and warmly welcomed by our server Eleyne. She delivered our drinks quickly and the cheese curd appetizer came out (hot!) a short time later (The curds were great, I highly recommend). 
Our main plates came out hot as well and were delicious, very generous portions, we brought home pulled pork and brisket for lunch the next day. 
Our entire dining experience was excellent from start to finish. We felt well attended and our tummies satisfied. 
We will definitely be back!

I was down in Madison for a business trip and needed a quick bite on a Friday. I came in and they were packed (I try to go for places filled by locals) and there happened to be a spot at the bar.

Jesse, their bar tender/server was amazing and took care of me the whole time all the way from food to drinks. The atmosphere was great, employees friendly and the food was amazing and surprisingly cheap for what you get. I would certainly stop by again when I have the chance.

Order the Rib, Pull Pork and Brisket combo for $26. The Rib was dry and hard, not the (meat) fall off the bone type. Pull Pork and Brisket was not good either. For $26 the portion was quite small, this should of been a $15 dish. I’ve been to a lot of BBQ places and I know good ribs, brisket and pull pork. 
Service is a 4 star. I tip base on good service. Food wasn’t worth it but the service was good. Nice set up and dining area.

Came here with my family we all enjoyed our meals. We were seated quickly for our big group which was very nice. Ordered a old fashioned sweet which was great! Our waitress was very nice but felt like she rushed us, I wanted to order another drink but by the time I was about to she had already put our bill on the table without asking if we wanted more drinks. Overall still would come here again.

I absolutely love this place.  My dad and I had the nicest waitress who was well informed with the menu and very helpful.  The food was to die for.  I enjoyed everything from the cheese curds appetizer to the brisket to all the tasty sides and even the BBQ sauces and dipping sauces were mouthwatering good.   I will be coming back and hopefully it will be frequently.  The atmosphere is warm, cozy and clean.  I highly recommend this place and think everyone should try it!

name: Weary Traveler Freehouse
address: 1201 Williamson St, Madison, WI 53703, USA
reviews:
Friendly folks. Delicious food. Willy Street unconventional at it's best. 

Go past the bar and sit on the other side if you want a quieter area. The mulligatawny is superb!

Great little haunt. Bob's bad breath burger will one day be my undoing, but I am willing to roll the dice for a burger with a hunk of cream cheese and green goddess dressing. Goulash is amazing. Great brunch. Lots of veggies and vegan options and I'm pretty sure they make their own bread. Great atmosphere as well.
Really cool place! I had a Reuben and a meat and cheese platter. Everything was great quality! Love the decorations on the walls!

The grilled cheese, the bad mouth burger!! The Weary Traveler's food is so good! We love this eclectic place! Additionally, the food is so reasonable for downtown Madison. We especially love it for brunch. 

Parking can be a little tough. I recommend parking on Willy street a block towards the capitol.

Loved this small local restaurant. Atmosphere is ecceclict and comfortable. Portions are large and we ended up splitting some items to taste them all. Burger, goulash and soup were outstanding. Service was good and we highly recommend this place for one of a kind home made meals.

name: Marigold Kitchen
address: 118 S Pinckney St, Madison, WI 53703, USA
reviews: This place gets busy and for a good reason. The food here is amazing! The dishes are also very creative and fun! I love how you get to order tour food first then the staff will bring out to once you’ve been seated. They have a variety of dishes, from sweet French toast that tastes like a cinnamon bun to spicy and savory breakfast nachos! Their coffee was also 👌

I love the rotating menu of soups and quiche. The baked goods are also quite good. I had the vegetarian soup bowl with a side of toast and was pleased by the amount of food (and of course by the quality). Seating is an issue if you go at peak times even during the week but it's still worth venturing to. Good vegetarian and a few vegan options.
Great place for breakfast. Delicious greens complete the meal. Just busy enough to be fun and casual enough to feel like home. Favorite!

I was blown away by how immensely flavorful everything had from the hot chain tea latte to the breakfast potatoes I had. This place had the cutest atmosphere and amazing service. So happy I got to try this while in Madison.

Came here on a Saturday morning for breakfast. There was a line to the door but it moved very quickly. Although it is counter service, they did utilize a host to seat us once we placed our order. Food and drinks were great.

name: Camp Trippalindee
address: 601 Langdon St 7th floor, Madison, WI 53703, USA
reviews: Food is delicious for a college campus bar. It exceeds my expectations. The view from the rooftop is beautiful. It is a cozy place with lots of boardgames available to play.

The camp theme is amazingly well done. The views from the outdoor lounge were great. It was a good place to spend an afternoon with food, cocktails and games to play at your table. Food is ordered at the bar, no wait staff. Burgers, fried chicken sandwich and impossible burger were all delicious. Due to the location the clientele seemed to lean towards out of town guests.

It's cool I guess. Sometimes you can take your theme to seriously. Uncomfortable chairs and other strange furniture choices. Burger was five guys quality so not bad but nothing to remember. The fries were okay and like everything else just mediocre. The service was poor as well. Great view though. Lots of boardgames which is fun. Just think they could have done more with this space.

We stopped up at the roof because we were staying at the Graduate, just to see what it was all about. While we didn’t get anything to eat or drink, the view from up here is fantastic! 

Like The Graduate, this bar holds very true to its “camp” theme. The decor is spot-on and makes you feel like you’re at summer camp in all the best ways. There are board games, a fair amount of patio seating, and excellent thematic touches. Even though we didn’t get anything, the staff was authentic and welcoming. 

We hope to stop back and enjoy some grub!

Fun place. It is camp themed. They call the bar tenders counselors, they serve bug juice, they have tons of games, a nice out door seating area, and you can even get a smores kit which has an flame in a can, marshmallows, chocolate, and Graham. They provide roasting sticks too. If highly recommend.

name: Paul's Pel'meni
address: 414 W Gilman St, Madison, WI 53703, USA
reviews: I eat here whenever I can make it downtown! Ask for double works if you like the sauce and they'll absolutely cover it for you! Service is usually quick, 5-10 minutes tops, and the dumplings pair very well with the beer selection. My only complaint is that parking can sometimes be a pain, but that's nothing on them. Try it!

Been loving this place since they came to State St years ago. Proof that a simple dish can be absolutely perfect.  My order is full beef with the works and an extra sour cream.  I also stop by Oasis Cafe in Fitchburg to snag them there as well.
Casual dining. Order at the counter and it is delivered to your table. Little potato filled dumplings with options of toppings and sauces. Full service bar.

Paul’s offers delicious food for an excellent price that students can actually afford. For $7 a plate (a large plate), I’d come here every night for dinner. It doesn’t help that Paul’s is in such close proximity to my apartment and all my classes 😉
Fantastic find.  A full order with the works is delicious and filling at a fair price. Great way to try some Russian food

name: Mickies Dairy Bar
address: 1511 Monroe St, Madison, WI 53711, USA
reviews: I was super excited to visit Mickie's Dairy Bar for the first time yesterday. It was like taking a step back in time. Such an iconic 1940's diner!  We visited on a slow day so did not have to wait in line to get a coveted table but I almost think that would have added to the experience. The fact people stand outside in line waiting for a seat pretty much says it all. The food is simply prepared, the portions are hearty and exactly what you want from your favorite breakfast joint. Our server was super pleasant and we wanted for nothing. I can't say enough about the pancakes. They're the size of dinner plate, dense, moist and incredibly flavorful. What a great experience. Thank you to the owners for keeping this old place alive and rocking. What a gem!

My all time favorite diner in the Madison area. They have such an authentic old school diner feel to it thats unmatched by other places in the area. Prices are fantastic for all menu items. Cash only yet so keep that in mind before coming in. They do all the breakfast and lunch classics and they do them big! You wont be skimped on here folks. Always big portions. They do sandwiches, burgers, pancakes, french toast, omelets, scrambles, skillets, coffee cake, shakes and malts, french fries...and sweet fries!, steaks, ham steaks and way more I'm forgetting. Never paid more than $15 for a big meal with add-on items and a drink. Fast customer service, kind staff and every walk of life is always present inside from the campus. Never know who you be sitting by if you take a bar seat, seriously, anyone!

Quaint little place. Looks like a hole in the wall dive. Great food great menu and quite possibly the best service I've had in my 3 months in Wisconsin so far. I didn't get the guy's name who greeted me at the front door he was wearing a Green Bay t-shirt and a Green Bay beanie. As soon as I walked in he greeted me immediately I told him I was interested in the corned beef hash and he told me all about the hash it was house made with several different spices that gave it a slight spicy kick but nothing overwhelming. I ordered the hash at the bar and a cup of coffee. I'm used to corned beef hash in Santa Cruz California Santa Clara California and San Diego California. I'm traveling United States in my RV and Jeep and seeking out great corned beef hash. This was a four out of five stars or a 7 out of 10. Just the right amount of spicy kick to make it a little different. I wish I had time to try the rest of the menu.

Just as good as I remember from college! My husband swears that they have the best corned beef and hash that he's ever had. If you want to get in without a wait, especially on the weekend, show up early - they're definitely busy by 8:30 or 9 am.
You won't go away hungry!
Still there and still tasty for that Sunday after funday. Good food served quickly by very friendly wait staff. Remember to be kind and tip 😉👌

name: Hạ Long Bay Restaurant
address: 1353 Williamson St, Madison, WI 53703, USA
reviews: Food was very good! Decorations were a bit sparse, and bathroom door didn't lock. I understand they are recovering from when a car hit their building.

We absolutely LOVE Ha Long Bay! They never disappoint, the food is worth the wait on those busy nights. The staff is always cheerful and friendly. Pictured is their PH1, Vietnamese rice noodle soup with rare beef, the chicken dumplings (fried and steamed), yellow curry fried rice and Thai Iced coffee. This restaurant has been a family favorite of ours for years now!

Quick service and great food. The prices are okay for the quantity of food served. The place was very busy for Thursday evening (could've been because of the holidays as well). They have imported beer in the drinks menu, should you prefer that. We ordered a whole red snapper which was fried and then some sort of lemongrass sauce added. The dish was served with broccoli and mushrooms, along with rice. Because it was whole fish (not fillet), the price was $45. The fish lacked spices and sauce and  perhaps that's the way it's supposed to be. However, I feel it be improved. Also ordered pho, which wasn't my favorite perhaps because of the consistency of noodles which I didn't like. There is some parking in the back and Street side parking and getting an open spot on a busy day might be a problem. Overall great experience. Will come back again to try new dishes.

I spent just 3 days in Madison but I visited Ha Long Bay restaurant twice!!! Despite the fact several restaurants were located around me, I still ignored the cold and went for this and it was absolutely worth it. The meals and waiters are super great! I tried new meals every time I went there and I enjoyed every bit of it. The only disadvantage is how crowded and busy the restaurant is but that is what you get when you have very tasty meals. Thanks Ha Long Bay for the very tasty meals. I would most likely visit again!!!!

They always impress me. I highly recommend their curries, noodle dishes, pan fried chicken dumplings, and sesame tofu. If you have a party of five or larger, you should make a reservation. The wait time can be upwards to an hour during their peak hours.

name: Taqueria Guadalajara
address: 1033 S Park St, Madison, WI 53715, USA
reviews: Great authentic Mexican food! Been coming here for years. Never had anything that wasn’t fantastic. One of the cleanest authentic taquerias I’ve been too! The go to place for Mexican food in Madison!

Wonderful local authentic Mexican restaurant! Amazing home cooked food. They are able to make anything on the menu vegetarian for you. It's great little restaurant for the whole family. It was really busy though so a few things got overlooked by our server. But other than that it was excellent. Definitely a new favorite for me. I love that they made a bean chimichanga just for me.

Very authentic. Excellent food. Great service. Awesome prices and good atmosphere. What more could you ask for? If you like hole-in-the-wall kinda places that are totally authentic and you want awesome mexican food, go here.

Mom n pop place for a quick bite. The parking can be a challenge on a busy day. Tacos were okay but I've had better tacos at other places. The service is quick and the servers are friendly. Overall a good place to eat if you are in the mood for Mexican food - although I'm not sure how authentic it is.

One of my favorite restaurants in town. I visit quite often. Amazing food, friendly service, great atmosphere. Love their beef tongue tacos and weekend menudo soup (best in town). For less adventurous eaters, you can also find all the classics.

name: Fresco
address: 227 State St, Madison, WI 53703, USA
reviews: A little bit expensive, but will worth the money. The salmon was cooked AMAZINGLY!! Most places overcook salmon. They were also amazing at balancing complex flavors.

Wow! What a fantastic dinner we had celebrating my parents wedding anniversary tonight!! The service, food and ambiance exceeded all my expectations. We were immediately greeted with exceptional service and sparkling wine to toast a significant anniversary.  Our waiter, Ian, was awesome!! His recommendations were spot-on and the food was amazing. From the BEST Brussels sprouts I’ve honestly ever had, to mouth-watering pesto gnocchi, seared scallops and a gorgeous dessert tray to top it off, it was all perfect! All of us thoroughly enjoyed this gem of a restaurant located downtown Madison, it was truly exceptional. Thank you Fresco Rooftop for making my parent’s anniversary extra special!!

I admire this place! They serve marvelous dishes, their menu is nice, The chief cook in that place is an expert, I like a lot eating all their food. The dishes are always of high qualtity, the service towards the visitors  is helpful. I often go to  this restaurant and I was never unhappy. I recommend it to all.
Great place!  Atmosphere was incredible,  as well as the view!!! Our waitress Jenn took very good care of us.  Definitely a return visit is in order!

Wanted somewhere special to celebrate Valentines eve with my special lady. It was everything and more!  You could actually have a conversation where the sound wasn't bouncing off the walls and ceiling.  The presentation of the food was exquisite, and the taste mouth watering.  If you expect a Golden Corral you have come to the wrong place.  Gourmet food at its best.  We will be back.....oh and by the way, Ira our server was excellent!

name: HungryBadger Cafe
address: above IT'SUGAR across Five Guys, 540 State St, Madison, WI 53703, USA
reviews:
So fantastic!  I had the dumplings with the Brats in them. Great combination and the spicy mustard was a perfect match. 

The chicken rice bowl was a perfect blend of flavors. Definitely not spicy but just a mouth full of flavors. 

Highly recommend.

Excellent meal! Went with several friends to try something new close to campus on a weeknight. Once we placed our order, everything came out quick. Delicious momo of many flavors were shared around the table: beef, chicken, and bratwurst. Can't wait to go back!

Great little place, upstairs from Its Sugar. It is easy to miss the door if you aren't looking closely. 
We tried the alu momo, classic chicken momo, chicken rice bowl and samosas and shared them as a group so everyone could try all the dishes. They were all wonderful! Staff was great. Small selection of beers and wine.
 Warning: the small bottle of Badger Heat sauce that you can add is super hot!!

Absolutely wonderful atmosphere! Beautiful energy! Amazing staff!! And the food is authentic as authentic gets! Hungry badger is a beautiful spot to take a friend/loved one & eat absolutely wonderful food at a very reasonable price!! You get such great food for such a low cost! Highly recommend this place!! If you haven’t eaten here, you have to!!
An absolute hidden gem!!! Amazing service, great food and drinks. They have awesome drink specials as well! The momos were very well seasoned and perfect for sharing. Highly recommend!

name: Harvest
address: 21 N Pinckney St, Madison, WI 53703, USA
reviews: 4.5 stars if it was possible.  Quality of the food was very good, quantity was okay.  Probably not the spot for big eaters, but definitely a great place to try.  Came during restaurant week, so menu was somewhat limited.

Great restaurant during the stay home order. I tried the asparagus soup, the bone in ribeye, and the dark chocolate cake. Everything was delicious, the soup was very smooth, the ribeye tasted great, its mashed potato was very good as well, and the dark chocolate cake was very delicious. There are 3 things that could have been better. I asked the ribeye to be medium, but it was rare/medium rare, so I put it inside my microwave for 2 mins to cook more. I requested for silverwares and napkins but both were not provided. Lastly, a $10 handling fee regardless of pickup or delivery seemed too high.

Gorgeous interior, varied menu, fantastic friendly staff. Food was great but, as the waiter admitted, the portions run small. On the positive side, a starter, main, and dessert are fulfilling but not overfilling.

We come back again and again. It’s our favorite restaurant in Madison from the very first time there. The staff are very attentive and offer a great experience. The food is delicious and always very fresh. The scallops are to die for. Thoroughly recommend Harvest.
Wonderful restaurant with great staff and fine dining ambience. Scallops are a winner every time. Well priced for the quality of service and food. Great wine list too.

name: Himal Chuli Restaurant
address: 318 State St, Madison, WI 53703, USA
reviews: This is my favorite restaurant. I’ve been coming here since I was a kid. Every time I come to Madison I eat here. The food is amazing and unique. I’ve been across the USA and haven’t found another restaurant quite like this. Wish I could eat here every day!

Beautifully prepared and presented foods. Not overly treated, each dish celebrated the items included and let those items be the star versus heavy seasoning or pretentious preparation. The staff treated us wonderfully. Great for vegetarian and vegan dishes.
This place is a great restaurant!  The food is magnificent! I've been going for over 20 years. I live in Milwaukee but go eat every time I go to Madison. I highly recommend it!👍😊

The food here has really interesting flavors worth exploring. Tiny place, charming & welcoming servers. Our plan is to make this our new place any time we are downtown or going to something at the Overture, to try lots of other items.

Delicious food, amazing service, with a cozy and convenient location.  It's no wonder it's been in Madison so long.  Leave time to sit and chat, this is not fast food.    The golden tea is worth both money and time.

name: Everly
address: 2701 Monroe St, Madison, WI 53711, USA
reviews: Enjoyed my breakfast selection tremendously, and the three others in my party enjoyed theirs, as well. Those little side potatoes were divine. Chef had no issues making a substitution to accommodate food allergies, which we appreciated. Nice selection of alcoholic breakfast beverages. Can't wait to try out the lunch menu!

Neat place to try out dinner. Good cocktails too. The steak frites were excellent. The brisket ragout was good. They seem to be trying to cram every food trend into their menu but if that's your thing, you'll love it.
We called and called. A good 30-45 mins before close. Well they must just want to go home early versus make money when people are losing their jobs no worries someone will take our money.

I can't say enough good things about this restaurant! Amazing atmosphere, plenty of staff so the best service I've had in a while. Delicious coffee, unique menu, handmade ingredients, but at a really good price! And talk about a beautiful interior! Good thing we made a reservation for Saturday night, it was nice and busy. Can be casual, but the table of suits and dresses next to us didn't stand out by any means. Can't wait to go back!

We had dinner here yesterday and food was great! We can taste the freshness of all ingredients. I’m glad to find restaurant who care about their customers and served quality foods that taste great. We ordered fried brussel sprouts and charred broccolis as appetizers. Let me tell you that I hate brussel sprouts and kales in general, but I love this dish here. Try it and you won’t regret. Charred broccolis was great as well. 
I got pesto pasta as my entree and it was delicious. My husband ordered fried chicken sandwich. My friend ordered roasted chicken. I didn’t try their dishes but they all said it was good.

Note: while this restaurant accepts kids but they are not the type to hand out crayons and drawing paper, bring your own if your kids need that.

name: Mr. Kimchi Modern Korean
address: 225 King St, Madison, WI 53703, USA
reviews: This is a hidden gem. The Korean menu has some very tasty appetizers and the sizzling purple rice is superb. The staff are friendly and attentive. There was no wait and the food came quickly. Evidently they just added a sushi menu - we will definitely be back!

Great Korean restaurant. This place is more of a modern Korean feel to it. Really enjoyed the atmosphere. I went for lunch and it wasn't too crowded. They had a great lunch menu. I opted for the spicy pork belly lunch box with purple rice. I definitely recommend it. The staff was very friendly and attentive. I will definitely be back.

This place is amazing! Such delicious food! This was my second time, and it was just as good. Not crowded, so the service was fast and the food came out quickly. It was really tasty, and the dishes were slight variants on traditional Korean which made it even more interesting. I will definitely be going back.

Do you ever go to places and wish that the food they served was as good as the photos they put up? If so, this is the place for you. Their Bibimbop is to die for, and with great sides and teas the meal comes together as a wonderful dinner for a reasonable price. Definitely worth a visit.

Yummie! Reasonable lunch price, fast and nice service. Order these two just to try. Ended up eating it all. The server though I was done with my steak lunch box and i told him "no I'm not done yet." Lol got there before the lunch rush and made out alive. Would go again next time. Great food and service.

name: Pizza Brutta
address: 1805 Monroe St, Madison, WI 53711, USA
reviews: Best Pizza in Madison! Every visit is so yummy
It takes effort and learning to create great pizza - the whole package from the crust to the bake. Pizza Brutta has achieved great pizza :)

Wonderful place! Authentic Italian style pizza made in large wood fire stove. Great location on Monroe St. Right on the bus line. Definitely can serve any size group, which is important for me to know based upon the work I do. Everything tastes and looks fresh. Pizzas can be watched being made in front of you. Such a comfortable, warm and cozy environment. Friendly and knowledgeable staff with warm smiles. Thank you, Darcy, for this experience! Your place is wonderful!
Great wood fired pizza here.  Friendly service and a very easy going experience.
Best pizza I've had in forever. Custom made, fast service. There's nothing like a brick oven pizza.

name: Bar Corallini
address: 2004 Atwood Ave, Madison, WI 53704, USA
reviews: This is currently my favorite Italian place to go for dinner with good wine and cocktails. Had e group dinners here in a month and a half and love it more each time. Richie the GM and Giovanni the Chef have this place working like a charm for service and for great food. Truly delicious Neapolitan style Italian food. Every dish I've had here has been amazing. Not yet had pizza myself but my dining pales seem to like it very much indeed. Prices are reasonable, service is fast even when busy. Staff is profession and kind. I love talking to Giovanni in Italian when I come in here. I think he likes it too. The artic char and the chicken piccatta are amazing dishes. The grilled octopus app is a must try as well. The Sicilian red wine is great with any dish! A must go place for groups if you want to impress and not break the bank or leave hungry all while having a great experience.

Excellent food, service, and atmosphere. Our server was extremely friendly and knowledgeable about the menu. Three of their pasta dishes have fresh, in-house made pasta. The rest are imported from Italy. We will be going back to try the pizza!

Just had brunch and let me tell you, it was fantastic!! Had the Egg sandwich, which is a meal or two, and the Kale salad is the best I’ve ever had. The Mimosa too is def the best I’ve had. They took time to squeeze fresh OJ and it showed. Service was fantastic. Space is fresh, clean and cozy. I could chill here for hours. Can’t wait to come back and try the wood fire pizza. Well done. A new favorite spot in Madison!!

Simply amazing! We celebrated our daughters 4th birthday at Bar Corallini and it was simply an amazing experience. The chef involved her in making her own pizza, the staff, almost all of them came to wish her a happy birthday, the food was nothing less than delicious. 5 star restaurant and 5 star experience easily! Thank you guys again!!! Quote of the night was “best birthday ever!”
Best Italian in Madison!!! Very good food. Beautiful clean restaurant. Staff are incredibly friendly. Thanks for an amazing experience.

name: Forequarter
address: 708 1/4 E Johnson St, Madison, WI 53703, USA
reviews: A cool, more intimate setting. We didn’t have reservations but were lucky enough to land a spot up at the bar. Great cocktail menu with many creative selections. The bartender also made some great suggestions for small plates to share as well as dinner. For our first visit to Madison, this was a great spot to find and add to our list of places to visit again when next in town.

A+ atmosphere the few times I've been now! The food is all really good too (try the cauliflower). I keep missing happy hour (4:30-6pm  on weekdays I think), which is sad b/c they have awesome deals on drinks and some select food items. The outdoor seating is nice. I'm not big on cocktails but you can see the attached drink menu if interested.

Coziest spot in Madison! Great food and decor. Some dishes slightly over salted, but still yummy. Reservation is a must - expect to be seated at the bar, which is equally cozy. Dumplings were amazing!

Our experience at forequarter was amazing! We stopped in for late lunch/early dinner on our first visit to Madison. The sign out front is rather nondescripts and doesn’t actually say that it’s forequarter but we figured it out. The atmosphere in this place is so very nostalgic, like something of another time. It’s small and cozy with chill vibe and jazzy music playing. I got the bobal wine with the help of Grace, our servers suggestion and my bf max got Great Dane brut IPA. Again with Graces kind guidance and recommendations, We went with some small plates first- the shaved parsnip salad and the rainbow carrots with a daikon tzatziki sauce. We were instantly WOWED. First impression was “now THATS how you show RESPECT to vegetables” so often veggies are treated as an afterthought on a plate and here these two small plates are the exact example of how veggies and using their flavor profiles can own an entire dish. Simply delicious. Additionally..each dish came out prepared almost like the perfect combination between food and a work of art. Their chef takes a lot of pride and passion in his work and that translates through to the food. Next stop we took was we got the red pepper dumplings large plate and the cheeseburger that was on the happy hour menu. The dumplings had a tough act to follow with those veggies and it didn’t knock my socks off but it was still really good, the broth was the best part in my option, but the burger was out of this world. Hands down one of the best burgers I’ve ever had. It was juicy, tender, simple ingredients, pickle meat mustard and the bread was phenomenal. I would’ve gotten two or three more if I had the room! And for only 5 dollars on happy hour! We finished our meal with the chocolate ganache which such an interesting take on a ganache! It has the perfect blend between sweet, salty and tangy. Additionally, grace our server was very sweet, personable and patient as we asked her all sorts of questions about the food and beverages etc. She made great recommendations and definitely contributed to our wonderful experience. Next time we’re in Madison we will be coming back! Highly recommend!
Unbelievably delicious. Wish I could afford to eat here all the time, def one of my favorite restaurants in Madison.

name: Sardine
address: 617 Williamson St, Madison, WI 53703, USA
reviews: "It's okay." That's what three stars on Google means. Very pricey for what you get. If you are just drinking, it's decent prices. The food is crazy expensive for the quality, and I would rather eat at any local bar even if the prices were similar. The wait staff very clearly does not want to be there. Either that or they hate you on a personal level. Guess they're pretending to be Parisian? I was there twice - a Saturday around noon and a Sunday for oyster happy hour ($1 off). This is the lowest rating I can ethically give of a place that hasn't personally wronged me. IF YOU are dragged here for brunch - get the waffles. Between the price and the quality, it is the only item I have found to be worthwhile. Very tasty.

I like the brunch. There is plenty of off street parking. The dining room is nice but I prefer the bar or a table with a lake view. The plate pictured is the savory oats. 1 drink is salty greyhound made from fresh squeezed grapefruit juice and the other cocktail is the beet juice body mary.

Fantastic brunch. Food was tasty. We had an awesome table by the window. The louder/livelier bistro setting made it more relaxed and i saw a few families with kids as well. I’ve loved this place since 10+ years ago and it is still amazing.

Great service (friendly and fast), great food (quality, portion sizes), and lovely ambiance (clean, homey)! My only "complaint" is that we made reservations several weeks ahead of time and asked for a window seat, but upon arrival there were no window seats open. We were still able to be seated right away so not a problem. I would definitely come here again and would definitely recommend it!

Ever reliable, semi-contemporary, lovely atmosphere, and good service.. are the factors that keep pulling me and most people I know back to Sardine!  Very well done and executed from brunches to dinners to private events. Food is reliably good/very good.. and matches the pricing. Great big bar area that still feels cozy and fun; knowledgeable staff. During summer they have outdoor seating; even with the parking lot in front it’s nice to see the lake. The interior has a more formal white table cloth dining area, as well as a more private spot to side where you can host a decent 20-25 people team dinner. They do well with organizing such events and customize the menu. I do recommend it. We live pulling up to the bar for a boozy brunch or a happy hour cocktail - has not disappointed! ... on replay!

name: Paisan's Restaurant
address: 131 W Wilson St, Madison, WI 53703, USA
reviews: Terrible management. 3 of 4 of our take out entrees were wrong. They offered to refund 1 of 4. No thanks. He asked what I wanted. Obviously to have all 3 incorrect orders made properly. He scoffed and said they couldn’t do that. Really!? We didn’t get what we ordered! We won’t be back. The food is decent but this is the final straw. I even came back after there was mold on my bread but now we are totally done after being treated so poorly.

Definitely the worst dining experience my family and I have had. Staff was poorly managed and unprofessional. The food was actually uneatable for all of us. We have never wasted food and not taken leftovers we couldn’t eat home before , but knowing how sick it made us we decided to leave our full plates there. Unclean and outdated place, the only nice thing was the view of the lake. Food was incredibly greasy. Here are some photos of all of our meals.

The place is very nice and well kept. The parking is a bit hard since it' in the basement and the ceiling is a bit low. Better than not having dedicated parking since that can be said to any downtown Madison restaurant. We sat outside in the sun. There are no oversized umbrellas so be ready to embrace the Sun and a decent breeze.

I ordered the Garibaldi with a glass of water. The sandwich seemed a little too simple in presentation versus the description, but it tasted good. Not a flavor punch, but good enough to enjoy.

I'll be interested in the other dishes the next time I come back! Yes. It's worth coming back.
Great atmosphere. Love the outside patio  during warmer days. The menu is great and my favorite their pizza. I would recommend Paisan to anyone. Special times or just a casual dinner.

The pizza and drinks are quite delicious here. They have their own unique oven toasted crust and house sauce. Try the deluxe pizza. 

The bartender was nice and made custom manhattans for us. Our waitress was also satisfactory. 

The food came out a bit slow considering that it wasn’t too busy and the mozzarella sticks were served with marinara in a plastic cup. This restaurant could be amazing if they were to improve a few small details; the main dining room has an epic view of Lake Monona.

name: Monty's Blue Plate Diner
address: 2089 Atwood Ave, Madison, WI 53704, USA
reviews:
Vegans rejoice. Monty's has you covered.

Must eat brunch or breakfast location in Madison. Do not skip this place. Food is amazing breakfast was fantastic.

The hashes were huge and the portions generous. Most ingredients locally sourced. Seating is plentiful and they accommodated for our large group. There is good seating outside.

Monty's Blue Plate Diner gets what it means to be a "diner." You walk in the door to a shiny tiled floor and a gleaming case of oversize freshly baked pies and immediately see the logo for Just Coffee Coop. You know that no matter what, you are getting an amazing cup of coffee. And, you know, that, in the parlance of restaurants, you save "some room" you will be rewarded with dessert. The food is diner fare, eggs, pancakes, etc., but the interpretation is elite. The eggs were served with a chunky buttermilk biscuit and crispy home fried potatoes. Really excellent. Line can be long to get a table because this place is popular, but it was worth the wait. Will return.
Excellent! We went around 11:30 on a Saturday, and the place was packed. The 45 minute wait was well worth it. Food is delicious and fresh, service was prompt and friendly, and the pies are amazing.

Monty's Blue Plate Diner is amazing! I ordered the Meatloaf Hash, and it is so delicious! The servers are all really friendly and the food is served quickly! I really enjoyed how casual of a place it is to eat because you can just relax and enjoy your meal. I also got a cinnamon sugar doughnut, and that far exceeded my expectations!!

Definitely one of my favorite restaurants in Madison. The only downsides are parking and how popular it is. Quite often during all hours it will be busy. Other than those things the food is amazing, fast and had more vegan/vegetarian options than almost any place i can think of. Im not those things but i go there for a damn good meal as often as i can. Go with a little time and it is worth the wait.

name: Green Owl Cafe
address: 1970 Atwood Ave, Madison, WI 53704, USA
reviews:
If you're in Madison and you have a craving for some delicious vegan or vegetarian fare, this is the spot!

Great character and tasty food make this place a great choice. I'm a meat eater and even I loved it (the mushroom veggie burger was so good)! The local artwork was a great touch, too!

Top notch vegetarian food at a reasonable restaurant price! I have yet to eat something at the Green Owl that I don't like - I particularly recommend their burgers. Plus you're supporting a local business ran by an amazingly innovative and dedicated new owner!!

Top notch vegan food with the bonus experience of being stared at by wooden owls as you devour your meal. What more could one ask? The owls will even grant you a dessert menu full of amazing options. Eat here immediately.
Amazing food with amazing dedication to service. Was absolutely blown away by the willingness to go the extra mile to make the best vegan selection.

Looks like they recently started having their $11 sandwiches delivered without boxes, but wrapped in an aluminium wrap. That's cringe-worthy.

Also, the TLT sandwiches they have been delivering nowadays sometimes has way too much lettuce, and little tempeh than they used to put in earlier.

name: Essen Haus Restaurant and Bar
address: 514 E Wilson St, Madison, WI 53703, USA
reviews: We met with friends at this restaurant for dinner. we heard about this spot from a lot of people.  Well, we were not disappointed. The staff were extremely nice and we felt good. The meal was yummy. We loved this restaurant very much and we will definitely return to this restaurant. We recommend this place to all.

The building looks pretty rough from outside if it would fall apart any second. However, people seem to enjoy very relaxed atmosphere. If you are looking for a classy place this is not the one. Centrally located and easy to access from John Nolan drive. If you like beer this is your place.

This place is my first choice restaurant.  Of all restaurants I know I favor it most. I never miss an opportunity to go to visit this restaurant. everytime  I feel like having a special dinner, this place comes instantly to my mind. superb and diverse  food and a rich menu.professional staff, and pleasant ambience. Also important, the tariff is good. I praise this place with pleasure.

This restaurant is  SO much fun!!
Our food was authentic DELICIOUS German food with all the delightful extras. 
It's hard to save room for dessert, but their Black Forest Chocolate cake is a dream come   

 true! The service from our waitress was the very best I've experienced in  years!
Don't miss this GREAT restaurant!!

I love this place! The food was amazing and they even had live polka music. Our waitress was very nice and did well to accommodate us despite the fact that they were packed the night we went. 

The Essen Haus also has Spaten Optimator on tap, which is my favorite beer.

name: La Taguara
address: 3502 E Washington Ave, Madison, WI 53704, USA
reviews: I love this place. Fast, friendly service. Plus, they do a great job with dietary restrictions. The catering options are great! I've done several catered events with La Taguara. Always a pleasure working with this team!

We arrived at this place for lunch. my friend recommended this spot.  Well, it was very nice. the staff were so friendly and we had a great feeling. The food was just great. We loved this place very much and we shall definitely come back again. Highly recommended.

Wow. If you love passion fruit- you will love this place! Just opening the door- toy can tell that the food is going to be good. The passion fruit glazed chicken wings with plantains were outrageously good. I really can't believe I haven't found this place sooner. The cheese  empananda was delicious and the sauce it comes with is so flavorful and delicious. I can't wait to go back and try more of the menu. The passion fruit cheesecake was very good too. There was nothing disappointing about our meal here. The service was good and staff was friendly.

Food was A+ and also quick given how busy it was. The host was so friendly. Good prices too. If I had one tiny suggestion it would be to have menus available to look at when you walk in - it was my first time there and the only available menus were at the cashier and we had to wait to view them until we were first in line

Loved it! Loved the food and loved the people! Everything was great but we especially loved the Arepas! Wow!! Get yours with roast pork, avocado and cheddar cheese. Can’t wait to come back. I’m thinking one arepa and the Cuban sandwich for the road.

name: R.P. Adler's Bar and Grill
address: 8202 Watts Rd, Madison, WI 53719, USA
