reviews: BBQ brisket plate, pretzels, and soup.  Service was great, the price was okay, and the food was okay. The pretzel was tasty, the brisket wasn’t my favorite, but I’m sure there are other things to order.  The soup was fairly tasty.

I came to visit this place under the recommendation from the hotel that I am staying at so I decided to walk down the street and try it. I went to the bar where they had plenty of seating in the bar area. I was greeted by the waitress of whom was very friendly. I ordered the spicy wings and they were really good. They were fried really well and had a good crunch to them which i like. The one draw-back was that there was not a lot of sauce that they wings were tossed with. I would recommend asking for extra sauce if you like your saucy wings. I ordered the pepperoni and sausage pizza and that was good. Pizza was thin crust. The sauce had good flavor and toppings were good. I would highly recommend the wings with extra sauce and its a good place to come to hang out and have a drink and relax with friends/coworkers

This is one of my favorite neighborhood haunts. I often come here for a beer or light snacks with friends, and it's exactly what you would expect from a pub-style American restaurant. The bar side staff are very friendly and accommodating - and after going a couple times in a row, the staff remembered my group and could suggest relevant drink options for us. 
Food recommendation: shrimp salad. Delicious!
Delicious. Their special pulled pork sandwich and Friday fish fry are amazing!

Ordered room service twice. That berry salad with no meat or eggs is a TOTAL WINNER!!! I didn’t care much for the apple crisp or the cheese curds, but I can’t rave enough about that salad. Delivery vs in restaurant could be the difference in both dishes. 🤷🏽‍♀️ I’ll definitely be back for that salad on my next visit to Madison. Nice delivery guy too.

name: Mediterranean Cafe
address: 625 State St, Madison, WI 53703, USA
reviews: Come for the food, stay for the ambiance and friendly staff. Excellent Algerian tea, fresh soft pita, tasty hummus all served in large quantities. Extremely quick service. They only take cash or check.
Just picked up lunch. It put us in our happy place. Great food and a great way to combat cabin fever. Thank you, Faycal!

Food is great!
I’d give 5 stars if they didn’t have such short hours of operation.
Only open a few hours for lunch Tuesday - Saturday.
Hours are so short, may as well call them minutes.

When they’re open, they’re often so crowded you can’t find a seat.
I remember the days when Med Cafe was open for lunch and dinner (until 7PM) six days a week.

Be ready! You will get your food within 5 minutes of ordering. Great lunch spot that is quick yet relaxing and warming. The culture of the food - and the music, decor, service - is alive. I almost always get the vegan lentil soup (it has a lemony hint which I love). Whenever I come to Med Cafe, it is an oasis, a self care treat, and I am 99% of the time pleased. Enjoy! Try the Algerian Tea for a sweet kick. The Greek Salad is very well rounded and lemony. Baklava for the win. Just about anything will serve you right.

Med Cafe is a magic place that will take you to distant lands with its delicious food, music, and service. It will feed not just your tummy but your heart. From lentil soup to Falafels, Hummus, Akin's Plate, Moussaka, Spinach Cheese pie, Ratatouille, everything is exquisite, don't be afraid to try something new. Ah! Don't forget to try the Algerian tea!

name: Parthenon Gyros
address: 316 State St, Madison, WI 53703, USA
reviews: I've never had a gyro before because I'm picky and I don't want to eat lamb, so I had the chicken caesar gyro and it was delicious! The guy who took our order was friendly, energetic and fun and he came over a couple times to see how we were liking our food, maybe because we had 3 first-timers? We appreciated his excellent customer service!
This place has always been a favorite in our household. And, they just gave their dining room a face lift. Looks and tastes fantastic!!

I just took my girlfriend to have her first Gyro here. This food is/was so delicious and perfectly made that it brought a tear to her eye. The food was ready promptly and everything was made with care and attention to detail. The staff was the definition of friendly and professional. They had wonderful, upbeat attitudes and made us feel welcome and appreciated. The atmosphere is charming, festive and comfortable. I highly recommend it to anyone who is a fan of Greek food or looking to try it for the first time. You will be happy that you made the stop!

How does this place have so many high reviews?  Drunk college kids?!

I have never been a fan of their overly greasy gyros and fries. Today we had a work lunch though and our manager was paying, so I decided to try their salad and some kabobs. We were missing my coworkers Baklava and my entire lunch order!  We work at the hospital, so we opted to have it delivered. After two calls and two hours later, I still have no food. They claimed there is nothing they can do cause the order was already delivered!?  What?!  I have NEVER had a restaurant not redeliver or at the least offer free food to get me to give them another chance. Instead, no food, no apology!
30+ years of gyros from parthenon.  Always good gyros and sauce.  Fries still are not really good.  Rooftop is nice.  Pretty clean and fast service

name: Laredo's Mexican Restaurant West Madison
address: 694 S Whitney Way, Madison, WI 53711, USA
reviews: I got the half chimichanga (chicken) it was pretty standard Mexican food fair. The chips were nice and crispy and had good flavor. The only problem was one of my friends that I was with tried to modify an order and I don't know if there was a misunderstanding or what but they could not seem to give him his order without covering it this cheese sauce. We sent it back once and didn't a second time because we didn't want to be a bother.  Perhaps we weren't clear but it was a little frustrating.

Found this hidden jewel in Madison. Upon entering instantly fell in love with the lower and floor level seating. Very tasteful and clean. Was greeted right away with smiles and warm welcomes. Now to the food. Everything from the chips to the main course was cooked to perfection and even tastier! Thank you for the welcomes and the amazing meal I so enjoyed!

Chips were flavorful and fresh tasting, no "old deep-fryer grease" taste like some places. Salsa heat was about just right. Everyone in our group of nine was happy with their meal and we all ordered different items. Minor confusion on billed items was expected with a group that size.

Wow! This was a wonderful dining experience! The service was quick and the staff were very friendly.  The food and drinks were delicious.  I went with friends and we stayed a few minutes to talk after eating. They started to get really busy so we left to free up the table. We appreciated being able to talk a little bit without feeling rushed-out. We will be back!
The food here is great!!!! Decorations are good and the customer service is great as well but I wish there were more people here so we can have a fiesta

name: Rare Steakhouse
address: 14 W Mifflin St, Madison, WI 53703, USA
reviews: Rare is an "Okay" place to eat. The ambience and decor is five stairs and would be the joint I would take clients to for dinner. My significant other went to Rare for a special occasion and were saddened that the hype didn't meet our expectations. I had the dry age bone-in ribeye which was a great piece of quality cut meat. Sadly the cap was seared so much that it burnt the fat to charcoal. Just plain sinful, but the rest of the steak was great. My significant other had the wet aged fillet which came out as Rare instead of Medium Rare and was surprisingly firmer side similar to a choice grade of meat.  Overall the food is enjoyable but not enough to write home about. The staff were very friendly and knowledgeable but my Significant other and I felt like the time between the our dishes (bread, wine, appetizers,entree) were short to the point of being rushed which hindered our enjoyment. About 5 min We went a slow night where there was no wait. My only problem with Rare is the service is too quick where you can't enjoy your experience.

Cannot say enough good things about this place! Would recommend to anyone considering a beautiful dinner downtown. The food was absolutely delicious and presentation was beautiful! The view of the capital out the windows was an incredible backdrop to our lovely dinner. Can here for my birthday dinner and was blown away! It can get a little pricey but it is beyond worth it! Come check this place ou!
The most amazing steak Ive ever had.   Jose gave us great service even though it got really busy while we were there.       The Teacher's pet drink YUM!!
The food is regularly fresh and delightful, cashiers hands out great customer service. I loved how neat it is and mood. Keep up the good work.
Amazing place! Wet aged capital cut is crazy good! Wonderful place to enjoy with friends/family.  Staff was super attentive and engaging... Try it and you'll love it!

name: Bonefish Grill
address: 7345 Mineral Point Rd, Madison, WI 53711, USA
reviews: Absolutely fantastic. Great food, reasonable prices, easy parking, easy access. The selection of wines was also very good. The best was our server Patricia. She went out her way to make sure we had a great experience. I cannot wait to go back again.

The best happy hour ever. The best adult juice boxes ever!(Raspberry Tom Collins) It is a great place to dine but also meet new people. The Bang Bang Shrimp is delicious and popular. The owner Robert, and his staff make everyone feel welcome. If you like to talk smart and meet new people meet us at the bar. Best time ever.
Very nice people. Don't be afraid to ask about their recommendations. Will be back when I'm back in Madison.

They are not set up for Curb-Side pick-up even though they say they are. I know a lot is going on in the world but I wasn’t happy with our experience. We ordered a Family Bundle. Shrimp was pretty good but veggie and salad were brown and far from fresh. Overall disappointed.

To go to Bonefish you must want to eat sea food! Well made and very fresh! They do have other tasty dishes not made with sea food. Sunday brunch! Coke products, good drinks and a nice wine selection.  Staff is friendly and wants to help to make your visit special. Booth or table seats.

name: Delaney's Steak Seafood Wine
address: 449 Grand Canyon Dr, Madison, WI 53719, USA
reviews: We took our son out for special night with Mom and Dad. Delaney’s did not disappoint! The bar area had a cool jazz band playing, the drinks were great. Our food and service was awesome once we sat down. They treated us great, without being pushy. The food was the star, I got a bone in Ribeye, flavor town! No dinner is complete without dessert, I had the creme brûlée...tasty!

Was really great! I had a T-Bone which I ordered medium. It came out rare which I completely understand with T-Bones. They took it back and fixed it and it was amazing. The only thing that kinda bugged me it the steaks don't tasted seasoned. Other than that everything else is amazing!

I have never been disappointed at Delaney's!  This long-established local supper club-style steakhouse does it right.  From the straightforward yet properly varied menu to the high professionalism of the staff,... on top of the consistently delectable quality of the dishes themselves,... Delaney's will continue to be my go to recommendation for out-of-town visitors looking for  a combination of tradition, high quality, and easy access in a delightful restaurant atmosphere. It'll also always be my go-to spot for birthdays and special occasions ;).

Best steaks in town! Not only for food but drinks and service. Their martini's they are the best around. Expect to pay about 50 bucks a plate, but for a nice night out it's definitely worth it. Plus, I always have left overs to take home.
I simply loved their food. I always get fantastic service there. The place is always clean and the cashiers are always nice. Keep up the good work.

name: Gates and Brovi
address: 3502 Monroe St, Madison, WI 53711, USA
reviews: Way cool place for group dinner. Been in twice and enjoyed myself each time. Great place for watching a game and for happy hour as well. Wide menu options for all tastes and dietary needs. The fisherman strew and chicken salad are staples for me. Great wine list as well. The carrot cake here is legit I promise. Made in house from scratch, love it! Kind staff, quick service and near vibe. True gastropub feel to the space. I really want to try their brunch menu on a weekend and there Friday fish fry. I hear both are spectacular. Good portions and fair prices.

Want to dine at a small local bar without all the hassle of downtown parking? Then look no further than this spot. A descent sized menu with a variety of food options and a great liquor, beer, and wine selection. Also, the hype is real. Their cheese curds are the top 5 of the town. It's a bit one the pricey side so if you are looking for cheap eats this is not the spot, but you are paying for the exquisite quality and service.

Worth a visit. Likely one of the nicer family-friendly restaurants around that also caters to folks without children looking to have an evening out. Just an enjoyable place to spend an evening. 

The setting is great, with a number of stylistic touches to reinforce its vibe. The cocktail menu was decent and people liked the beer list. The food looked amazing, but it seemed to be lacking something. I’m not sure quite what exactly, but something was missing. You can see from all the photos I shared that the offerings are diverse and the dishes were well-prepared and plated carefully; the salmon and roasted carrots in particular was well-constructed. The fries were cooked enough to have the rich brown coloration and the greens served with the burgers were fresh and well-dressed. Unfortunately, the food looked better than it tasted, but neither the presentation nor the food were bad. Definitely an above average restaurant and great place for an evening with friends or family.

We arrived a little after 8 PM on a Friday night, we were seated right away, even tho it was busy, they found a place for us.  Adrian, our waitress was exceptional.  She suggested a glass of wine for our meal along with describing their mouthwatering specials.  We were not disappointed in the spicy chicken sandwich topped with slaw or the bowl of savory Italian sausage & potato soup.  Their menu is rich with home made delicacies, will have to save room for dessert next time we're there.
My favorite burger in town is the G&B burger! One of my go-to restaurants I've been loving for years! They are great at accommodating larger parties as well if you call ahead.

name: Muramoto Hilldale
address: 546 N Midvale Blvd, Madison, WI 53705, USA
reviews: The atmosphere is slightly fancy, like it would seem upscale. BUT there was a variety of people. We tried the Maki Combo which was chef's choice. We got the Godzilla Roll, spicy tuna and salmon roll. It was delicious and just enough to share and filling. Definitely recommend. The menu prices fit the area.

What can I say, it's excellent sushi. The calamari is also fantastic which we ordered extra crispy and will absolutely do again. We also shared the Godzilla roll, tarantula roll, and Ecuador roll. The amount of caviar on the Godzilla and tarantula rolls do not disappoint. The sauces that the sushi is on top of are also a great blend that goes well with each roll.
Great food,. Service was even better. We were new comments and Amy gave great suggestions on what we should have 😁
Best sushi place in town. There are also great options for who can't eat raw foods. You could try black cod with rice and dragon roll.

One my favorite sushi/sashimi destinations. Great rolls, too. Outside of that, not a huge menu but what they have for soup, salad, apps, entrees is sufficient to cover the basics. Check the menu online to see if it meets your needs. Enjoy your sushi experience!

name: Otto's Restaurant & Bar
address: 6405 Mineral Point Rd, Madison, WI 53705, USA
reviews: Cute supper club.  Very good dirty martini.  Great for a leisurely dinner.  Does take a little time for your delicious food. My scallops were AMAZING.  We were on our way to another event so we didn't get to try their desserts. Definitely a great place to spend an evening.

We've been going to Otto's for many years.  Good news - food is always excellent.  Bad news - menu never changes and now the service in the bar area has gone from excellent to very poor. We've always enjoyed the atmosphere in the bar area, but the last 3 times we were there, we waited from 20-30 minutes for a bartender to wait on us; even after waving them down a few times.  It's time to find a new place to go...
This spot is first-rate and broad, the meals was enchanting and the prices were very affordable. fast, productive service and very welcoming staff. Highly recommended.

Good atmosphere and food. Their tasting menu was a good deal as you got an appetizer, a main course, and a dessert for $30. This is only valid Monday to Thursday. The taste and the food quality were amazing. However, if you come here to purchase their regular menu, it will be very pricy (~$30-40 for just the main course).
This restaurant gives fantastic service and enjoyable food. One of the best restaurant around here. The food and drinks served fast and the rates were fair. Highly recommended.

name: Tipsy Cow
address: 102 King St, Madison, WI 53703, USA
reviews: Cheese curds here were really good! I think they use something different in their batter as it had a nice onion taste! Also got their buffalo sauced and Asian sauced wings. The buffalo had a nice kick while the Asian sauce was more on the plain side, but overall a great meal! Definitely a good location due to being at the square and I recommend people to definitely give it a try!

Great Customer Service. The bartender and wait staff were super helpful and prompt. Happy hour specials were great and the specialty fries were a meal in itself. Great selection of local brews of all styles with a full bar available for cocktails. A great visit if in the downtown Madison area.

Sat outside; it was busy but service was still great. Ordered the cheese curds and Tipsy burger; both were amazing. I ordered another round of cheese curds because one wasn't enough. And obviously a Spotted Cow to wash it all down. Five stars and I will be going back next summer when I'm in town.

In my experience, one of my favorite options among the vast array of Madison pub food options. They have your classic offerings (burgers chicken strips, etc), some items you might not expect  (fried alligator bites), and tasty fusion options (Korean beef fries, pictured below.) My personal favorite item they serve is the fried walleye sandwich (pictured below)! It was very generously sized and very moist. 

TLDR: The Tipsy Cow differentiates itself from other pub/bar offerings in Madison by offering very high quality affordable eats with more creative flare than one might expect from a restaurant in its genre.

Great service with really good food. We would suggest the Tipsy Chicken or Griddled Turkey & Havarti.. delicious! They really like the Nueske bacon here and you'll appreciate it too. Don't forget to eat your pickle. It completes either sandwich.

name: Parkway | Family Restaurant
address: 1221 Ann St, Madison, WI 53713, USA
reviews: Parkway is always good! I almost always get one of the specials. Delicious food, sizable portions, and menu options to please everybody. I took away one star because I should never have to ask for a coffee refill in a place like this. But overall a good choice for breakfast, lunch, or dinner.

We ordered for the first time today via Eatstreet, my son was looking for waffles and Parkway Family Restaurant was the closest place. I nervously ordered as I’m picky in the sense that if I don’t like the taste, I won’t eat it. We ordered waffles with scrambled eggs and bacon as well as chicken strips and cheese curds. The waffle was huge and delicious, eggs were cooked (not runny) and not over cooked (dry), the bacon was crispy, big, and not burnt! Chicken strips were crispy and well seasoned, I was impressed! The cheese curds were crispy and not over cooked, a little salty but that happens. Overall an amazing experience I can’t wait to repeat!!

The Texas Toast French toast was not anything special, and the hash browns were extremely greasy and left a weird chemical (maybe oil/grease?) aftertaste in my mouth. This is really unfortunate, with all of the great reviews I was hoping for a good experience. Maybe just these 2 items are not that great, and other items are better...
Amazing restaurant. With covid happening we had to order delivery but the food is phenomenal! They give huge portions, and the service was super fast. Will definitely eat here again!

Been working in the area for the last week. Order takeout twice and each time the food was delicious and I don't need any added seasoning. Will definitely be coming here anytime I'm working in the area and in need of some homemade food

name: Miko Poke
address: 2701 Monroe St #250, Madison, WI 53711, USA
reviews:
One of the first poke places in Madison, and still one of the best. Very consistent, well-made poke bowls with solidly prepared seafood. Little touches on all the ingredients elevate Miko Poke above other fast casual restaurants; it genuinely feels like care is put into everything they serve. Rotating monthly bowls keep things interesting (I liked the January pork option a lot), and the Monday buy-one-get-one-half-off special is really nice. 

One of my go-to takeout places in Madison.
They are absolutely delicious, great service! Love that they are local and love to support them!
Awesome place to eat something when in a hurry. Their service is efficient, prices are affordable, fantastic vibes. Would recommend to others

This place was delicious! I'm certainly not claiming that it tasted exactly like real Hawaiian poke but if you're looking for something fresh and delicious then this is definitely it. Bonus points for having a separate compost, recycle, and trash bin with help for what to put in each. We will be back!
Awesome ingredients. Friendly service. I wish they had more house recommendations. One of my favorite healthy choices.

name: Merchant Madison
address: 121 S Pinckney St, Madison, WI 53703, USA
reviews: Came here for brunch. Sat at the bar and got great advice from the bartender on cocktails and food. We loved the scotch egg appetizer and the country fried steak and the hot chicken sandwich dishes were excellent. This was a great bar with a very cool atmosphere. They have beautiful and creative menus as well. Would definitely recommend this place and would come back if ever in Madison again.

First time in town and we ended up at this fantastic restaurant. The cocktail menu was out of this world and drinks were both creative and super delicious. We also had our first cheese curd experience — cheese curds in a buffalo sauce... yum! Everything about Merchant left a lasting impression. The bartenders were helpful with cocktail and dinner suggestions. A definite must-visit-again when back in town.

Tried this place for restaurant week. Food was really tasty, but it's a VERY loud place. The classic cheese curds had a really good breading, and the lamb sliders were a really nice balance of savory and sweet with the caramelized onions. The strawberry rhubarb trifle had a really nice tart jam.

Merchant is a great place to get dinner downtown. Their menu is small but wonderful — the food is always fresh and well-prepared. We've never been disappointed!

They do a weekly date night deal on Tuesday that makes it a bit more affordable as a regular thing, which we really appreciate as well.

All in all an excellent restaurant with beautiful decor and great food!
We always have an amazing experience at Merchant. Our favorite brunch place & date night spot. Be sure to check out their wine selection.

name: Double 10 Mini Hot Pot
address: 1272 S Park St #2102, Madison, WI 53715, USA
reviews:
Have eaten here 5 or 6 times and have enjoyed the food each time. Curry base is my favorite but everything seems good. Usually packed and can get uncomfortably warm in the summer due to the moisture build up from the boiling but wouldn’t keep us from eating here!
Service is good and the staff is always helpful to explain things.

Great food and friendly staff, I highly recommend dining here. The hot pot with lamb and the spicy broth is my favorite. You get to choose your own unlimited noodles to cook in the broth and create your own dipping sauce. They keep adding fresh hot broth to your pot as you eat. You will not leave hungry.

This is a wonderful place to enjoy hot pot!  I'm not sure if there are other places around town, but we tried it on a whim a couple of years ago, and where my wife and I go on our date nights when the season gets to be cold out.  The wait staff is friendly, and the food is delicious!  The "make your own" sauce bar is fantastic.  I would definitely recommend trying their suggested sauce posted on the the bar.  AYCE starches which include linguine style noodles, rice noodles, sliced sweet potato, eggs, etc.  A gem in Madison!!
This place is worth visiting. They serve large portions for fair rates. Always clean and with fantastic atmosphere. Will come visit again.

LOVE THIS HOT POT EXPERIENCE! I tend to not like family style dinners and really dont enjoy sharing food (I know, bad...) but love hot put which is all about family style but this place gets you your own personal hot pot and wow is it amazing!

name: CIRC
address: 1 W Dayton St, Madison, WI 53703, USA
reviews:
This is my first time trying Circ on a weekday. I was really impressed by the salad bar, which has much more than salad. The beef barely soup was amazing!! It was fresh made and had huge chunks of beef. 

Circ, which is part of the Concourse Hotel, is a relatively mid to upscale restaurant. The service is excellent, as is the food generally. 

Try the Sunday brunch, you won't be disappointed.

We had the wonderful breakfast buffet this morning and it was so special! So many choices of very well made food and a french toast made out of a homemade donut was to die for.

The service was also exceptional. Very personable and kind. I would choose this place to start my day, every day.
Above-average hotel dining.  Solid choices of both starters and  entrees. Generous portions, and half-size options for all pastas. Courteous and professional service.

The hostess of this restaurant on February 15th made the four of us feel completely inadequate for being there.  When we walked up to her, she looked us up and down a few times and said in a snippy voice:  “Can I.......help you guys?”   Looking at the 25 empty tables it looked very likely that we would be seated immediately.   I politely asked if there was room for the 4 of us to eat.   The hostess said that the tables were all booked and the earliest we could be seated was at 8:30 (3 hours later).  I mentioned all of the vacant tables and she said that she was expecting everyone to come in at once.  At that point, we knew she felt we did not belong and went to spend our fortunes elsewhere.

My husband and I enjoyed dinner and breakfast here when staying at the hotel. Dinner was excellent. We ordered a cheese board with only one cheese sample, the seasonal cheese. It was delicious. My husband and I both ordered lamb. He ordered his well done while mine was medium rare. They were made just as ordered. Breakfast was good. If I stay at this hotel again I will definitely eat here for dinner.

name: Bandung Indonesian Restaurant
address: 600 Williamson St, Madison, WI 53703, USA
reviews: Food was very good. Service was excellent. They took great care of our large party. Awesome way to end a 13 hour road trip.
Good restaurant during the stay home order

My favorite restaurant in Madison. The staff is awesome, every dish is delicious, and the portions are great. My fiancé and I are both vegan and they are so accommodating. There are a ton of dishes we are able to choose from and we love them all! You can also get their tempeh to go (3 for $10) and use it to cook at home. We can’t say enough good things about this place!
I've been here numerous times and never disappointed.... Everything taste different.... Their small lunch options are pretty satisfying and the veggie egg rolls that come with lunch are to die for

I’ve been eating my way around the menu, and I’ve always loved every dish- my partner is a hardcore mango curry fan, and the pad Thai really is the best in town! Also, pop by for one of the Indulge parties on the first Friday of the month- rotating artists, Dj’s, and a cute buffet of food- my husband raves about the spicy meatballs!

name: Slow Food UW
address: 1127 University Ave, Madison, WI 53715, USA
reviews: Great food affordable price
Went there to experience Chef Andy's food using fermentation.

This is an awesome way to get exposed and also eat an awesome meal that is fresh and supports local producers/farmers. The people there are also great and sitting next to a stranger and meeting someone is part of the experience too
Delicious dinners for only $5 on Mondays!

name: Dairyland Family Restaurant
address: 716 Cottage Grove Rd, Madison, WI 53716, USA
reviews: Dairyland is our family's favorite restaurant in the area - and that recommendation spans 3 generations so far! The servings are generous and the food is great, especially the breakfast food, where you absolutely cannot go wrong! For example, their crepes are way better than the crepes we've had in creperies! The staff are delightful, warm, welcoming people, and eating there feels like a real treat all around, yet is very affordable. We very highly recommend Dairyland Family Restaurant!

I decided to take my friend here after reading good reviews. Wonderful little local restaurant. We came on a Saturday afternoon and it wasn't overly crowded. The menu is huge and offers all 3 meal options. You can tell the food is homemade and they put quality into it. We loved it and will come back in the future. Very good!

Very much enjoyed our "to go" lunch yesterday from Dairyland. We go there often and always receive excellent food + excellent service from wonderful employees. They go out of their way to help you enjoy your day. 
SHOP LOCAL 🇺🇸

Stopped in to check this little diner and was surprised at the taste of their food. Fresh and large portions. Would recommend it to anyone. Soup and salad together puts the icing on the cake. Dont forget their pies.
Good amount of food for price. Friendly and warm atmosphere, cheese curds were great
